Please apply as soon as possible. Deadline: 24.08.23. For any questions please contact Milena Miccoli tel. 99 51 72 63 / milena.miccoli@akkodisgroup.com

title: Spennende mulighet som service tekniker
description:
Service Tekniker - RIS
                Vil du være med å utvikle Rig Inspection Teamet (RIS) i Bergen?I Odfjell Technology er vår visjon å bruke vår arv og kompetanse til å støtte det grønne skiftet, parallelt med å levere produkter av høy kvalitet innen dagens olje- og gassindustri. Vi leverer tjenester og teknologi som reduserer tid, kostnader og karbonutslipp for våre kunder.Odfjell Rig Inspection Services er en del av Odfjell Technology som er et børsnotert selskap som tilbyr inspeksjon, installasjon og vedlikeholdstjenester til rigg og faste installasjoner. Selskapet har over 2000 ansatte og er til stede i mer enn 20 land over hele verden. Ved å kombinere 50 års bransjeerfaring med morgendagens teknologi, utvikler våre medarbeidere løsninger for energimarkedet i endring.Besøk www.odfjelltechnology.com for mer informasjon om hvordan Odfjell Technology investerer i grønn teknologi og de spennende prosjektene som gjennomføres innen vind, hydrogen, geotermisk boring og energioptimalisering.Odfjell Rig Inspection Services opplever en økning i aktiviteten innenfor hele vår portefølje, og vi ser derfor etter motiverte og ambisiøse personer med solid erfaring innen kran og løft. Hvem er du:Vi ser etter en person som har stort engasjement for yrket sitt og ønsker å gjøre en forskjell. Hvis du er lærevillig og samtidig villig til å bruke din erfaring og utdanning i Odfjell RIS sin interesse, kan du være den vi leter etter.Som et nytt medlem av Odfjell-familien vil du bli oppfordret til å bruke initiativ, erfaring og ekspertise for å bidra til å levere selskapets visjon. Uansett lokasjon, forventer vi at våre ansatte representerer våre kjerneverdier ved å være kreative, kompetente, resultatorienterte og engasjerte, samtidig som de alltid er sikkerhetsbevisste. Krav til gode muntlige og skriftlige kommunikasjonsevner, med norsk og engelsk som et minimum. Man må også beherske høyt tempo, være utadvendt og serviceinnstilt.Oppgaver:Generelt servicearbeid på kraner, maskiner og utstyrUtføre installasjon, reparasjon, ombygging og modernisering på maskiner og utstyrÅrskontroll på små og store løfteinnretninger og løfteredskapFeilsøking på hydrauliske, mekaniske og elektrotekniske maskiner og utstyrUtføre konsulenttjenester mot Odfjell Drilling og aktuelt eksternt markedUtarbeidelse av tilbud og oppfølging av prosjekterReisevirksomhet Offshore følger stillingenKvalifikasjoner:Fagbrev og/eller teknisk fagskole innen Elektro, Mekanisk eller Hydraulikk5-10 års erfaring innen service og sakkyndige tjenester for kran og løft Erfaring med forskrifter og standarder innen kran og løft (NORSOK R-002 & R-003 og tilsvarende) Operasjonell erfaring med inspeksjon av kran og løft (kontrollør G4, G5, G8, G20, G11, D7)Evne til å jobbe systematisk og selvstendigDu må trives med varierende arbeidsoppgaver, være fleksibel og trives i et dynamisk arbeidsmiljøØnskelig med godkjenning fra Sjøfartsdirektoratet B/B-1Vi kan tilby:Odfjell gruppen er grunnlagt på en kultur av respekt, selvstendighet og åpen dialog, og er kjent innen energisektoren for å rekruttere folk av høyeste standard og investere i deres kontinuerlige utvikling. Vi tilbyr muligheten til å få verdifull erfaring, sammen med konkurransedyktige betingelser, fordeler og en tilfredsstillende og motiverende arbeidsplass med fokus på kontinuerlig læring og utvikling. Våre ansatte er stolte av å jobbe i Odfjell gruppen.Besøk karrieresidene våre på www.odfjelltechnoloy.com for å bli kjent med flere av menneskene som arbeider i Odfjell Technology og deres arbeidshverdag.Interessert? Ta kontakt for mer informasjon om stillingen og hvilke muligheter vi kan tilby riktige kandidater.We live our core values - creative, competent, result oriented, committed - while always being safety conscious

title: Vil du være med på å forme en bærekraftig fremtid?
description: I Hydro har store industriprosjekter alltid vært i sentrum av selskapets utvikling. Projects er en spesialisert og dedikert prosjektorganisasjon i Hydro. Vår hovedoppgave er å utvikle og gjennomføre investeringsprosjekter på en strukturert, effektiv og forutsigbar måte. Vi leverer prosjekter og tjenester til alle forretningsområdene i Hydro konsernet. Projects vil spille en viktig rolle i å nå Hydros mål om å opprettholde posisjonen som en ledende leverandør av lavkarbonaluminium og å vokse i nye energisektorer. Projects innsats er avgjørende for den grønne omstillingen. Projects opplever stor etterspørsel fra alle forretningsområdene i Hydro. Vi er involvert i mange spennede prosjekter i forskjellige faser, fra forretningsutvikling til bygging. Dette er prosjekter innen fornybar energi, resirkulering og aluminium. For å styrke Projects' fremtidge leveranser søker vi nå etter en erfaren Project Procurement Manager for å styrke vår kommersielle enhet.  Hva vi tilbyr  En viktig rolle i Hydros ambisiøse ambisjon om å bygge fornybar industri innen aluminiumproduksjon, resirkulering av aluminium, vannkraft, hydrogen, vind, sol og batterier.   En mulighet til å delta i spennende prosjekter innen industriutvikling og samtidig bidra til en sikker, bærekraftig og forutsigbar prosjektgjennomføring.   Være en del av en profesjonell prosjektorganisasjon med moderne og velprøvde metoder innen HMS, prosjektstyring, anskaffelser og teknisk ledelse.   Som vår kollega vil du bli en del av et tverrfaglig og mangfoldig team og vil samarbeide med alle forretningsenhetene i Hydro.   Som ansatt i Hydro blir du en del av et selskap preget av mangfold, inkludering og tilhørighet. Vi tilrettelegger for fleksibilitiet og hjemmekontorordning for at våre ansatte skal ha en god balanse mellom jobb og fritid.   Hvem ser vi etter? Vi ser etter deg som har erfaring med å lede og gjennomføre anskaffelser i større investeringsprosjekter. Du har sterke samarbeids- og kommunikasjonsferdigheter, og blir motivert av å være en del av et team som jobber mot felles mål. Du liker å jobbe tverrfaglig, er nysgjerrig på å forstå det større bildet og er proaktiv for å finne gode løsninger. Vi setter pris på ett stort mangfold i avdelingen, og dette vil vi gjerne opprettholde og ønsker kandidater med ulik bakgrunn velkommen. Vi liker at kollegaene våre ønsker å utvide sin kompetanse utover sin kjernekompetanse til flere disiplinområder eller prosjektfaser. Dette bidrar til økt fleksibilitet for avdelingen og økt læring for den enkelte.  Hovedansvar Stillingen omfatter ledelse og gjennomføring av anskaffelsesprosesser for ulike prosjekter som Projects har ansvaret for.  Samarbeid på tvers av prosjekt team og ta en aktiv rolle i det respektive kontraktsteamet   Etablere strategier, markedsvurderinger, prekvalifiseringer, forespørselsdokumenter   Evaluere, forhandle, tildele og følge opp kontrakter   Støtte og rådgi prosjektteam og organisasjon   Drive utvikling og forbedring av anskaffelsesprosessen; prosedyrer, beste praksis dokumenter, metoder og verktøy  Ditt ansvar i prosjektet vil avhenge av din rolle, kompetanse og erfaring.  Ønskede kvalifikasjoner  Høyere utdanning innen relevant fagområde   Relevant erfaring fra industri og investeringsprosjekter er en fordel   Kunnskap og erfaring med kontrakts standarder som NTK og Norsk Standard   Interesse for systemer og digital utvikling   Erfaring med Omega365 og SAP MM er en fordel   Flytende skriftlig og muntlig engelsk, og gode ferdighet i norsk eller annet skandinavisk språk   Vi ser etter kandidater som er komfortabel med foretningsreiser  Tilleggsinformasjon Legg ved følgebrev og kopier av relevante akademiske karakterutskrifter, vitnemål, attester mv. Kun søknader mottatt gjennom vårt online system vil bli vurdert, ikke via e-post. Som en del av rekrutteringsprosessen bruker vi Semac til bakgrunnssjekk. Søknadsfrist: 03.09.2023 Hvis du har spørsmål kan du kontakte:LederEllen Mohr Dye, Head of Project Delivery Compliance and CommercialMobil: (Norway +47) 95283105RekruttererPer-Ole TorvundMobil:        (Norway +47) 95995304

title: Opportunity to work as group lead for Cable and Loop design in a large EPC greenfield project
description: Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry. Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”For one of our clients we are looking for a skilled EIT Cable engineer to work as group lead for Cable and Loop design in a large EPC greenfield project for an unmanned O&G installation. The right candidate will join a major new build project and will have the opportunity to develop his/her Technical skills within EIT cable, loop and termination design and personal skills in a large international project-working environmentTasks include:- Group Lead for personnel performing Loop, Termination and Cable design for EITA cables.- Follow-up cable routing in project database - Cabsys (EIS)- Responsible for planning and coordination of resources, deliverables and work methods- Responsible for cable termination and generation of Loops in SPI- Responsible for engineering of cable network, MTO’s and cable deliverables- Use of NavisWorks (3D model viewer) or E3D in cable routing design- Interface to other disciplines, construction, suppliers and clientRequired Education:- Education Bachelor degree or Technical College combined with minimum 12 years’ relevant Norwegian Continental Shelf experience- Ex courseRequired Work Experience:- Minimum 5 years’ experience from electrical engineering in projects located on Norwegian Continental Shelf.- Experience and thorough knowledge of electrical and cable design according to relevant standards such as NORSOK and IEC.- Knowledge of IS-calculations and FebDok-calculations.. Experience with SPI (Smartplant instrumentation) or other termination tools.- Familiar with working in 3D models.Required Qualifications:- Efficient communicator, who communicates well in English - Both orally and in writing- A natural team player, but possess the ability to work independently- Systematic and accurate, with high loyalty to deadline and quality requirements- You are proactive, you have a willingness to learn, you seek advice and share own experiences with others- Innovative approach, eager to improve methodology and solutions through digital toolsPlanned start date: ASAPPlanned end date: 13.07.26

title: We are looking for a new Program Manager
description: Devices Technology Group (DTG) - We are looking for a new Program ManagerLocation: Lysaker, Oslo, Norway The Opportunity:The Customer Quality and Operations team located in Oslo, Norway, is looking for a talented and motivated Engineer with great communication skills to fit the role as Program Manager. If you are interested in audio, video, cameras, microphones, AR/VR, touch devices, gadgets and IP networks, and at the same time are interested in how it all works together, we want to talk with you!We are looking for Engineers that can bridge the gap between our customers, our Engineering Team and Product Management. You have a curious, thorough and a scientific mindset, while at the same time you are able to present Cisco in front of our customers. As part of the Customer Quality and Operations team you will be responsible for program managing the beta program for our new AR product, Hologram. This includes collecting feedback, help with technical questions, pro-active follow ups, customer visits and being this products champion within the rest of the organization.As a part of this team, you will also be tightly integrated with the Escalation Team who handles all last line product escalations into engineering. Education Requirements:B.Sc. / B.Eng. / M.Sc. / M.Eng. / Ph.D. from a top ranked University with a degree in the areas of Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.Experience with troubleshooting IP networks and/or audio/video devices.Experience with IP network and audio/video devices. Eligibility Requirements:Graduated with undergraduate or graduate level degree within 24 months of start dateAbility to live and work in Norway with no additional visa sponsorship from our customerMust be fluent in English and NorwegianSome travel will be expectedStart Date: Flexible depending on academic schedule with opportunities available for immediate start We look forward to hearing from you. Attach a detailed CV that shows your competence and a letter of application that explains why you are applying for this particular position. We continuously process applications for the position. For questions about the position contact Ann-Christin Suphammer tlf.+47 901 67 646 email: ann-christin.suphammer@akkodisgroup.comAkkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry.Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”

title: Piping Support Lead - Senior Engineer
description: With Aibel you have a chance to develop your career through a range of projects in renewables and oil and gas. We call ourselves Engineering Pioneers. Whatever our job is, we approach it with creativity, curiosity and a drive to find new and better solutions. First we imagine the future. Then we build it. We are looking for a Senior Engineer to strengthen our Piping Support department in Asker. As a Senior Engineer you will contribute to Aibel's exciting journey in the ongoing energy transition.About the positionIn this position, you will be given a chance to use your motivational and mentoring skills when leading younger team members. A Senior Engineer has various tasks and assignments but you should identify as a natural leader with a cooperative and respectful working attitude. Responsibilities and tasks includeLeading the Pipe Support designers for various projectsAdvising the designers on all Pipe Support activities, including design, calculations and drawing productionHave an overview of the project as a wholePrepare Pipe Support procedures, standards, etc for individual projectsPrepare documentation for purchasing, tag linking, support material library, support bad list, etcSite follow up at construction yardQualificationsBachelor's or Master's degree8-15 years work experience, preferably EPC new build and modification on Pipe Support EngineeringAbility to perform structural calculations for supportsExperience with Aveva Everything 3D (E3D) modelling toolOffshore and fabrication experience is an advantage but not a requirementBroad NORSOK knowledgePrevious Aibel experience preferredPersonal qualitiesEnjoy leading and mentoring team membersYou are proactive, solution oriented and enjoy sharing your knowledgeA team player but ability to work independentlySystematic, accurate and able to get work doneBecome our colleagueAibel offers many career opportunities. With us, you can work across disciplines, build competence and develop your own potential. This contributes to a vibrant and engaging work environment. We also offer flexible working hours, and our welfare clubs have a wide range of activities and training opportunities for all our employees.Our overall strategy is to strengthen and grow the company's strong position within various energy segments, including offshore wind, oil and gas and hydrogen. At the same time, we always pursue new opportunities. Aibel sees social responsibility as a fundamental prerequisite, and sustinable development is therefore a natural part of our guidelines, work procedures and decision-making processes.We value diversity and work targeted to secure inclusion of all employees.Can you identify with our values, and are you inspired by our vision? Then we would like to hear from you!Application deadline and contact information:For questions regarding the position, please contact:Thomas Cleveland, Section Manager Piping & Layout, +47 99487660, thomas.cleveland@aibel.com.Work Place: AskerApplication deadline: 10.09.2023

title: Researcher/Senior Researcher within analysis of photovoltaic power systems
description:
IFE is announcing an open position as a senior researcher in the Department of photovoltaic (PV) power systems. The right candidate has experience with PV, power electronics or power systems. He or she will work in an inspiring and expanding environment at IFE, in close collaboration with leading Norwegian and European companies and/or research institutions. Through our close collaboration with leading renewable power producers addressing both PV but also hydro and wind power, including battery storage, IFE has access to data from a range of utility scale PV power plants globally. The work will be performed in close collaboration with other departments at IFE, such as the Department of Energy System Analysis, Wind, Battery and Hydrogen. The candidate should have education in physics, power electronics, computational physics, energy system analysis or similar, and preferably have relevant experience with PV systems. Competence in programming, especially Python, is also highly relevant. Further, we seek a candidate that can work independently but also participate actively in the group, has strong skills in English, and a positive attitude.In this position, some travelling must be anticipated. Arbeidsoppgaver
                Modeling of energy systems incorporating PV and energy storage Modeling of PV-based hybrid power plants Analysis of data from PV power plants Active collaboration with other departments at IFE, research partners and the industry Publication of research papers Communication and presentation of research results Project management Initiate and write project proposals Kvalifikasjoner
                PhD within physics, electrical engineering, or power electronics (or similar) Experience within Energy/power systems, including PV power plants. Experience from electrical engineering and planning Experience within publication of research papers Experience with programming in Phyton Proven ability to generate new projects Excellent oral and written English Fluency in oral and written Norwegian is preferable, but no prerequisite Personlige egenskaper
                Ability to work interdisciplinary Analytical Systematic and quality conscious Self-driven with initiative Excellent collaborative and communicative skills Vi tilbyr
                Work in an industrial relevant and research-intensive environment with focus on innovation Access to relevant, high-quality data and research infrastructurePossibilities to design and pursue new research projects and research interests within PV power systems and hybrid energy systemsAn informal, positive working environment with friendly and knowledgeable colleagues Competitive salary according to agreement Flexible tasks and working hoursSocial benefits including pension, life insurance and accident insurance We view diversity as a strength in our work. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, religion and ethnic background.We place great emphasis on your personal suitability for the position. IFE is subject to the National Security Act, and the candidate must be able to pass a background check and must be able to obtain security clearance and authorization.

title: Vil du være med på å forme en bærekraftig fremtid?
description: Hydro Energy har mer enn 100 års erfaring fra produksjon av fornybar energi. I dag er vi en av de tre største vannkraftprodusentene i Norge og en betydelig markedsaktør i Norden og Brasil. Vi er ansvarlig for å utvikle nye forretningsmuligheter for Hydro innen både fornybar energi, hydrogen og batterier, og vi støtter alle Hydros forretningsområder innen kontrakter, forsyningssikkerhet og rammevilkår for energi.Siden 1905 har Hydro utviklet naturressurser til verdifulle produkter for mennesker og virksomheter, med fokus på trygge og gode arbeidsplasser for våre 30 000 ansatte på flere enn 140 steder i verden. Hydro skal være ledende i arbeidet med å utforme en bærekraftig fremtid og ønsker å skape mer livskraftige samfunn gjennom nyskapende og effektiv utvikling av naturressurser til løsninger og produkter som betyr noe.Har du en lidenskap for IT-ledelse og bærekraft? Da har vi en spennende mulighet for deg! Hydro Energi ser etter en IT Operations Manager til avdelingen IT & Digital. Som IT Operations Manager vil du spille en nøkkelrolle i å sikre stabil og kostnadseffektiv drift av avdelingen. Du vil arbeide tett med leverandører, ledere og andre interessenter for å drive forbedringsarbeid og planlegge budsjett, samt følge opp kostnader og hendelser. Hos oss er det også mulighet for ytterligere karrieresteg i et stort internasjonalt selskap som bidrar til en grønnere verden gjennom utvikling av fornybar energi. Hydro har et sterkt fokus på bærekraft, og vi er stadig engasjert i spennende prosjekter for en mer miljøvennlig fremtid. Stillingen sitter på hovedkontoret i Oslo og du blir en del av et team på syv stykker.Arbeidsoppgaver/ansvarsområder: Følge opp applikasjoner og sørge for at de fungerer optimaltAnsvarlig for innkjøp og kontrakter knyttet til IT-områdetBudsjettering av IT-kostnader i samarbeid med lederKontinuerlig kostnadsoppfølging og fakturabehandlingDrive forbedringsarbeid med vårt IT Service-apparat, inkludert oppfølging av kritiske hendelser og etablering av KPI'erSamarbeide med IT-koordinatorer på våre kraftverk for å oppfylle deres behovSikre gjennomføring av opplæringsprogrammerAnsvarlig for lisensoppfølging og koordinering av drift mot Energis DevOps-teamFølge opp utvalgte leverandører og representere Energi i sentrale Hydro-forumFasilitere risikovurderinger og Business Impact workshops med relevante ledereDelta og representere Hydro Energi i prosjekter som kjøres i Hydro CorporateJobbe prosjektbasert med forbedringsarbeid i Hydro EnergiØnsket kompetanse: Bachelorgrad innen IT eller tilsvarendeMinimum 5 års relevant erfaringØnskelige personlige egenskaper: Som en del av Hydro-teamet får du en unik mulighet til å utvikle dine lederegenskaper. Vi ser derfor etter en person som kan bygge sterke nettverk og relasjoner med mennesker rundt seg. For å lykkes i rollen tenker vi at du er systematisk, presis og strukturert i arbeidet ditt, og trives med å løse komplekse utfordringer.Bli med i Hydro-teamet og bidra til å forme en bærekraftig fremtid gjennom innovasjon og teknologi. Søk i dag og bli en del av vårt dedikerte team som jobber for en grønnere verden.Annen informasjonVi ber deg vennligst legge ved alle relevante vitnemål og karakterutskrifter med din søknad. Vi aksepterer kun elektroniske søknader. Søknadsbrev og CV mottas ikke på e-post.I vår rekrutteringsprosess benytter vi oss av Semac bakgrunnssjekk.Søknadsfrist: 03.09.2023 Dersom du har spørsmål kan du kontakte:Leder: Terje Øfsdahl, Head of IT and Digital - Hydro Energi Mobil: (Norway +47) 41297633Rekrutterer: Magnus Hallerud Christensen Mobil: (Norway +47) 47849693Hydro går i en ny og spennende retning, og vi er avhengige av ulike perspektiver for å løse oppgavene våre og møte kundenes behov. Vi bygger på våre tre kjerneverdier - omtanke, mot og samarbeid - og har som mål å ha et bærekraftig arbeidsmiljø med høy prestasjon basert på inkludering av forskjellige mennsker. Vi oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater til å søke på stillingen.

title: Tekniker - produksjonsanlegg i Akershus Energi Varme AS
description:
Vi ønsker oss en engasjert medarbeider med stor interesse for bærekraft og teknologi innen fornybar energi. Akershus Energi Varme AS produserer miljøvennlig fjernvarme og fjernkjøling til våre kunder i Lillestrøm, Lørenskog og Nes, ved bruk av fornybare energibærere som flis, bioolje, el, spillvarme, sol og pellets. Selskapet er i vekst og det investeres betydelig i økt produksjonskapasitet, og flere spennende prosjekter er under etablering. Vi styrker laget og søker nå etter en ny tekniker til produksjonsavdelingen. Vi ønsker oss en person som er fremoverlent og som ivrer etter å løse store og små utfordringer i driften av anleggene. Du må være drevet av ønske om å jobbe med fremtidens bærekraftige energiløsninger, og trives godt med varierte og til tider hektiske arbeidsdager, i godt samarbeid med flinke kollegaer. Arbeidsoppgaver
                Daglig drift og vedlikehold av anlegg, med tilhørende rapportering og dokumentasjonBidra til optimalisering av anlegget for effektiv utnyttelse av produksjonskapasiteten Gjennomføre periodisk tilsyn og kontrollVære kontaktperson og gjennomføre oppfølging av eksterne entreprenørerBidra til god orden i og utenfor anleggDelta i daglig HMS-arbeid og bidra til oppfølging og lukking av avviksmeldinger tilknyttet anleggInngå i selskapets vaktordningKvalifikasjoner
                Relevant fagbrev, fag- eller høgskoleutdanning med praksis. Relevant erfaring kan kompensere for manglende utdanningDet er en fordel med kjennskap til drift og vedlikehold av prosessanlegg, termiske energiløsninger eller større kjøleanleggDet er ønskelig med kjeleoperatør- eller kjelepassersertifikatErfaring med bruk av IT-løsninger for produksjon og administrasjonFørerkort klasse B Må beherske norsk godt skriftlig og muntlig samt ha basiskunnskaper i engelsk Personlige egenskaper
                Vi leter etter deg som: Liker tekniske og utfordrende arbeidsoppgaver og å jobbe frem gode løsninger Er iherdig og kan stå på når det er behovEr pålitelig, strukturert og nøyaktig i arbeidsutførelsen Tenker at sikkerhet kommer først og har en aktiv holdning til HMSTrives godt med å jobbe i et lag, men også kan jobbe selvstendig og ta ansvar Bidrar med positiv energi til vårt gode arbeidsmiljø Vi tilbyr
                En spennende og variert arbeidshverdag i et lite og oversiktlig arbeidsmiljø med gode kollegaerGode utviklingsmuligheter med kurs og kompetansebygging. Har du de rette egenskapene og viljen, er vi villig til å investere i din utviklingMulighet for deltakelse i utviklingsprosjekterKonkurransedyktige betingelser Akershus Energi Varme er et selskap i Akershus Energi konsernet. Selskapet er organisert i tre avdelinger. Produksjonsavdelingen har ansvaret for drift og vedlikehold av selskapets anlegg. Selskapet har 14 medarbeidere, og det samarbeides godt på tvers av alle avdelinger. Som tekniker vil du jobbe med medarbeiderne i alle avdelingene. Stillingen inngår som en del av Akershus Energi Varmes beredskap, og ved behov vil det være arbeid utenom ordinær arbeidstid. Arbeidssted vil primært være i Akershus EnergiPark, men det vil være mulighet for å kunne jobbe ved våre øvrige anlegg i Lillestrøm, Lørenskog eller Nes. Arbeidsgiver har biler til disposisjon for reiser mellom produksjonsstedene.Er dette interessant hører vi gjerne fra deg! Logikum As er engasjert av Akershus Energi Varme for å bistå i denne prosessen. For nærmere informasjon kontakt Baard Langballe , tlf. 969 11 870 mail: bl_at_logikum.no. Inkludering og mangfold: Akershus Energi mener at inkludering og mangfold er en styrke. Vi trenger medarbeidere med ulike kompetanser, bakgrunn, erfaring og perspektiver for å bidra til enda bedre oppgaveløsning. Så langt det er mulig vil vi tilrettelegge for medarbeidere som har behov for det. Er du en spennende kandidat med litt  annerledes-bakgrunn , som vil tilføre vår bedrift framtidsrettet kompetanse, ser vi fram til å høre fra deg. Relativt nyutdannede vil også bli vurdert og vi ønsker oss gjerne flere kvinnelige kollegaer. Om Akershus Energi: Akershus Energi Varme AS er et selskap i Akershus Energi konsernet.Akershus Energi har produsert fornybar energi i over hundre år, og er i dag et moderne konsern som satser bredt innen vannkraft, vindkraft, fjernvarme, solkraft og -varme og hydrogen.Et av selskapets viktigste oppgaver er å bidra til å nå klimamålene i regionen, ved å sørge for utvikling og økt produksjon av fornybar energi og smarte energiløsninger. Konsernet har ca. 90 ansatte og eies av Viken fylkeskommune. Hovedkontoret er i Lillestrøm.

title: Opportunity in major EPC greenfield project
description: Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry. Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”For major client in Asker we are looking for a Piping Engineering - Senior/Principal EngineerJob Responsibilities-Calculate and establish pipe class sheets & work instructions & Guidelines. Check calculations, pipe class sheets and its components.-Follow-up on changes to International Standards and Aibel and/or Client Specifications.-Assist/comments to Piping documentation, technical requisitions, purchase orders: check supplier documentation according to specifications (piping components, valve interface, instrument interface), check piping interface to equipment packages, input/ checking of P&ID’s( spec breaks, PDS), etc.-Development of PDS.-Assist in all technical issues on general level. Evaluate and respond to technical queries.-Participate in new greenfield projects in different design phases.-Contribute to the improvement and further development in the Piping Engineering Department.-Multidiscipline pro-active interaction, seeking advice/share experience.-Piping Design if required.Required EducationBachelor’s or master’s degree.Required Work Experience-Minimum 10-15 years of EPC greenfield task work experience on offshore and or onshore Oil and Gas- or as a piping/stress/material engineer.-General experience in piping engineering, including piping component calculations according to ASME/EN.-Experience in riser / flow-line calculations to ASME/DNV, including piggability and 5D bends is preferred.-Experience in selection of high pressure connectors i.e. Mechanical hubs/joints etc.-Experience in work with PCS, PDS, VDS, MDS.-Experience in high pressure piping and steam piping is preferred.-Calculation experience. Candidates with experience with Calculation of Pipe Classes(min. 5-10 years). Internal and external pressure and branch reinforcement calculations will be preferred.-Experience in AVEVA E3D design.Required Qualifications-Comprehensive understanding of International Standards ( EN, ASME, ASTM, DNV, API), Norwegian Acts and Regulations(Trykkdirektivet/PED) and Project Specifications. Familiar with NORSOK.-Knowledge of Asme B31.3, Asme B31.8, Asme B31.12, Asme VIII and Subsea.-Good knowledge of process and flow diagrams.-Good coordination skills between all disciplines and good presentation skills within teamwork.-Systematic, multidiscipline understanding and solution oriented approach.-Have a cooperative working attitude and be systematic, accurate and detail-focused.-Intercultural competence and acceptance for multicultural working teams.-Skilled in excel.-IT experience, coding/programming skills is preferred but not required.-Good communication skills both orally and in writing-Good Norwegian and/or good English language skills in both orally and writing is required.-Good information skills.Planned start date: 01.08.23Planned end date: 01.08.25

title: IT manager, infrastructure & operations
description:
Rosenberg Worley AS delivers complete solutions within EPCIC projects (engineering, procurement, construction, installation, and commissioning). We are an important player in the Norwegian offshore energy industry, and we are embracing new markets for a sustainable future including floating offshore wind, electrification, hydrogen, and ocean farming. We have exciting projects underway and are looking for individuals that want an active role in the digital revolution and the global energy transition. Who are we looking for?  Rosenberg Worley AS has a complex and mixed IT environment with fabrication equipment, offshore connectivity, traditional IT, as well as localized and customized in-house developed solutions and applications for office-, fabrication- and engineering users. We are looking for a proactive candidate with an ability and willingness to combine independent leadership and planning with an operational hands-on attitude. Ability to build constructive and effective relationships, and balance competing priorities are prerequisites. You are a team player who understands that successful communication with the business requires translating complex technical matters into a non-technical language. The successful candidate will be managing a team of 4 people, extensively interfacing with local and global IT resources, as well as the business community. With Rosenberg Worley AS continued business success our IT team has many exciting activities and projects which offers great growth opportunities for the right candidate.Areas of Responsibility
                Manage the local IT infrastructure, fabrication equipment and operations teamCollaborate with the global DSS team (based locally), focused on “standard office IT”Work together with other local and global IT teams on running, upgrading and maintaining IT infrastructure, application backends, systems and automations Create and maintain documentation of owned solutions and systemsWork through the Regional and Local structure to ensure global corporate strategy alignment balanced with local business requirements. Assist global functions to manage relationships with local IT hardware, software and applications suppliers, and service providers. Implement relevant global standards and methodologies to maintain technology and business processes in support of the business. Collaborate with our clients in projects including system/application integrations. Train employees, troubleshoot and provide technical support as needed. Qualifications
                Higher educational background in IT at a BSc level or above. Experience may compensate for lack of education. Relevant industry experience in IT, ideally for an EPC environment, would be beneficial. Broad understanding of IT standards, practices, methodologies, and technologies. Familiarity with, or qualification in, ITIL is preferred. Experience delivering IT services and projects, to defined standards of performance and cost, and preferably managing IT budgets. Familiar with IT audits, writing/maintaining procedures and addressing the practical implications of such. Demonstrates an understanding of IT technology including Servers, SANs, Voice and Data communications, application management and deployment. Experience with Cisco inter-site networking, Active Directory, Azure, Citrix, RDP protocol, virtualization infrastructure (preferably VMware), PowerShell, networking and communication protocols, is an advantage. Fluency in Norwegian and English with great written, oral, and presentation skills We believe that providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.

title: Lidenskapelig opptatt av ingeniørfaget? Form fremtiden med Odfjell Technology og søk ingeniørstilling hos oss i dag!
description:
Ingeniør og Senior Ingeniør
                I Odfjell Technology er vår visjon å bruke vår arv og kompetanse til å støtte det grønne skiftet, parallelt med å levere produkter av høy kvalitet innen dagens olje- og gassindustri. Vår misjon er å trygt levere tjenester og teknologi som reduserer tid, kostnader og karbonutslipp. Vi er et børsnotert selskap som tilbyr integrerte offshoreoperasjoner, brønnserviceteknologi og ingeniørløsninger. Selskapet har over 2000 ansatte og er til stede i mer enn 20 land over hele verden. Ved å kombinere 50 års bransjeerfaring med morgendagens teknologi, utvikler våre medarbeidere løsninger for energimarkedet i endring.Odfjell Projects & Engineering er en del av Odfjell Technology som i flere tiår har vi levert skreddersydde ingeniørløsninger til våre kunder innen olje- og gassindustrien, samt til Odfjell Drilling-flåten. Vi leverer et bredt spekter av tjenester ved hjelp av tverrfaglige team, hvor vi alltid inkluderer det operative perspektivet i prosessen. Vi definerer omfanget og designer den optimale ingeniørløsningen, samtidig som vi håndterer prosjektutførelse og installasjon.Odfjell Projects & Engineering opplever en økning i aktiviteten innenfor hele vår portefølje, og vi ser derfor etter motiverte, proaktive og ambisiøse ingeniører og Senior ingeniører til teamene våre i Bergen og Stavanger innen:BoreutstyrElektro & InstrumentMekaniskRørProsessStrukturMarinVedlikeholdTeknisk IntegritetSubsea TeknologiBesøk karrieresidene våre for mer informasjon om hver av stillingene og bli bedre kjent med hvordan Odfjell Technology investerer i grønn teknologi og de spennende prosjektene som gjennomføres innen vind, hydrogen, geotermisk boring og energioptimalisering.Hvem er du:Vi ser etter en person som har stort engasjement for yrket sitt og ønsker å gjøre en forskjell. Hvis du er lærevillig og samtidig villig til å bruke din erfaring og utdanning i Odfjell Projects & Engineerings interesse, kan du være den vi leter etter.Som et nytt medlem av Odfjell-familien vil du bli oppfordret til å bruke initiativ, erfaring og ekspertise for å bidra til å levere selskapets visjon. Uansett lokasjon, forventer vi at våre ansatte representerer våre kjerneverdier ved å være kreative, kompetente, resultatorienterte og engasjerte, samtidig som de alltid er sikkerhetsbevisste. Krav til gode muntlige og skriftlige kommunikasjonsevner for å samarbeide effektivt med kollegaer og kunder, med norsk og engelsk som et minimum.Ønskede erfaring:Sterk teknisk kompetanse og erfaring med olje- og energisektoren og offshoreoperasjoner er sterkt foretrukket. Dette kan inkludere arbeid med boring, produksjonssystemer, mekanisk-design, subsea-teknologi, installasjoner, vedlikehold eller prosjektledelse.God kjennskap til helse, miljø og sikkerhet (HMS)-krav og praksis som gjelder offshoreStrukturert, nøyaktig, systematisk og evne til å levere innen fristerEvnen til å arbeide selvstendig og samarbeide effektivt med tverrfaglige team, leverandører og kunder er nødvendigErfaring med å planlegge, koordinere og styre prosjekterAnalytiske ferdigheter: Evnen til å analysere tekniske problemer og bruke relevante verktøy og programvare for teknisk analyse og modellering er viktigTrives med å bidra til problemløsning og finne innovative løsninger på komplekse tekniske utfordringerKvalifikasjoner:Teknisk, bachelor- eller mastergrad innen ingeniørfagErfaring kan kompensere for manglende formell utdanningEkstra fagbrev er en fordelOm du ikke kan krysse av for alle kriteriene ovenfor, men føler at du har noen av de relevante ferdighetene og erfaringene vi er på jakt etter, så oppfordrer vi deg virkelig til å søke likevel. Vi vil gjerne at du sender inn en CV som tydeliggjør dine overførbare ferdigheter og erfaringer.Vi kan tilby:Odfjell-familien er grunnlagt på en kultur av respekt, selvstendighet og åpen dialog, og er kjent innen energisektoren for å rekruttere folk av høyeste standard og investere i deres kontinuerlige utvikling. Vi tilbyr muligheten til å få verdifull erfaring, sammen med konkurransedyktige betingelser, fordeler og en tilfredsstillende og motiverende arbeidsplass med fokus på kontinuerlig læring og utvikling. Våre ansatte er stolte av å jobbe for Odfjell-familien.Interessert? Ta kontakt for mer informasjon om stillingene og hvilke muligheter vi kan tilby riktige kandidater:Jan Erik Berge - Engineering Manager Bergen | +47 45513093 |Kjartan Håkonsund - Engineering Manager Stavanger | +47 48156224 |We live our core values - creative, competent, result oriented, committed - while always being safety conscious

title: Are you our new Applications Engineer?
description: Applications Engineer Corvus Energy is the leading global supplier of zero-emission solutions for the ocean space. We specialize in developing cutting-edge battery energy storage solutions and hydrogen fuel cell systems to reduce emissions from a wide range of applications, from ferries and offshore vessels to tankers and cruise ships. Our commitment to sustainability and innovation drives our pursuit of powering a clean future. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Electrical Application Engineer with a strong background in power systems to join our dynamic team in Bergen, Norway. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in designing, testing, and implementing battery systems for various applications and collaborate closely with our cross-functional teams to ensure the successful integration of our battery solutions into diverse applications.  Responsibilities: Work closely with customers to understand their battery system requirements and technical specifications. Configure system solutions based on customer requirements. Technical follow-up of projects Support our integrators with mechanical, electrical and control system design. Support the risk analysis and class certification of battery installations. Technical documentation Responsible for support to the installation and commissioning team Identify and implement areas for product and process improvements. Provide customer support and solutions to technical issues.  Work Experience and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a relevant engineering discipline, preferably electrical. Relevant work experience can compensate for formal competence. Experience in power system integration is an advantage. Prior experience with the maritime industry is a plus. Good digital skills and experienced user of MS tools. Experience from using Dynamics365 and/or CAD is an advantage. Some traveling can be required. Personal Qualifications: Detail-oriented personality type, self-starter, structured, ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced collaborative environment. English and Norwegian fluency. Good written and verbal communication skills. Drive and flexibility to fit in with a growing company.Our Corporate Values In Corvus Energy, our values provide a guideline for the correct behavior and create a common understanding amongst employees. These values are aligned with Corvus Energy’s strategic goals and reflect our company’s leadership vision. These values also serve as guiding principles for all leaders and set out our expectations of leadership conduct. We act with Integrity We act with Innovation We are Team Players We are Passionate Benefits We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience, along with a comprehensive benefits package that includes health insurance, a good pension scheme, and opportunities for professional development.  Joining our team will provide you with the chance to work on cutting-edge technologies that contribute to a sustainable future. As an organization, we also strive for a good work–life balance and a healthy lifestyle. We offer healthy varied lunches and snacks as well as sports and social activities outside of work. If you find this position interesting, we encourage you to apply. We are a fast-growing company with a strong demand for our products, being the undisputed market leader in one of the most exciting industries in the ocean space. Join our team and be a key player in our success story of powering a clean future all around the world.  We encourage all interested candidates to apply. All necessary company-specific training will be given.  If you have any questions about the position, do not hesitate to contact Team Lead Applications Engeneering – Erik Aurbakken: +47 954 92 311We encourage you to send an early application and will call for interviews on an ongoing basis until the position is filled. We do appreciate every application received, however, only candidates with a relevant background will be called for an interview.

title: Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?
description: At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future. We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?We are looking for an experienced bids & tenders professional with passion to develop their career within tender management and governance roles. This role sits in our Business Development function within Strategy, Portfolio & Sustainability segment. This team focuses on global sales opportunities and tender co-ordination, tender processes governance, improvements and tools to assist of our global business segments. Your responsibility will be to manage our tender processes compliance across all our business units. You will have great opportunity to create a broad network internally with multiple stakeholders and senior management across the business.This role reports to our Vice President Sales Operations, and can be seated at our Oslo or UK office.If you are a highly motivated people person with a passion for business development, tender governance and tender management, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.What will you be doing?Responsible of governance for our global tendering processes.Maintaining and advising on tender governance procedures, workflows, checklists and templates.Advise and support the global Business Development teams across the business units.Arranging and coordinating key control meetings and related approval process (e.g. Bid/No-bid, Management reviews, CEO and Board Approvals etc.)Ensuring accurate and quality information is captured thorough collection of meeting minutes with actions and memos for key control approvals.Establishing and managing the superuser network for tender governance in the segments.Providing training and required material on tender governance for the organisation.Streamlining business development processes and implementing related improvements.We think you should have:Minimum bachelor’s degree in a relevant field.3-5 years of experience in tender management.Structured and organized work mentality.Strong people and relationship-building skills.The ability to drive processes by supporting and challenging others.Strong communication and presentation skills.The ability to adapt to change and new ways of working quickly and easily.More reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projects ranging from oil and gas, renewables (carbon capture, hydrogen, and offshore wind) to aqua cultureA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per weekInterested? Contact us.For more information about the position, please contact:Marco Gabelloni, Senior Vice President Business Development: email: marco.davide.gabelloni@akersolutions.com. Mob: +39 3408534182Diversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

title: Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?
description: At Aker Solutions, we design, manage, and build some of the most complex energy projects in the world. We are committed to the transition and are at the leading edge of decarbonizing oil and gas and developing zero carbon energy. Building on our renowned front-end engineering skills, we are creating a world-class consultancy which will utilize the experience and data gathered from our early mover advantage in such areas as low carbon oil and gas, electrification, CCS, hydrogen and floating offshore wind to provide robust decision-making analysis and advice to our customers. We are now looking for a Junior Weight Estimator who wants to join our team of multidiscipline estimating specialists (Weight, Cost, Schedule) at Fornebu.In the developing energy mix, commercial risks are as prominent as technical risks, and our consultancy will provide broad multi-faceted advice to our customers. This developing market, coupled with an unprecedented demand for our execution experience, means that we are looking to grow our consultancy team with technical, consulting and commercially minded individuals who can help us meet the challenge of a just and orderly energy transition. What will you be doing?Learn about weight and quantity estimating in Aker Solutions for traditional offshore projects, renewables, and low-carbon solutionsParticipate in weight estimating for concept studies and FEEDsSupport collection of as-built dataParticipate in improvement of Aker Solutions’ competitive positionPerform benchmarking and quality assurance of weight estimatesSupport development of tools and methods for weight and quantity estimationPrepare and present information to corporate and project management, as decision making supportSupport other project control activities in the departmentParticipate in study and FEED reviewsInteract with estimation personnel across Aker Solutions’ global organizationWe think you should have:Bachelor’s degree in engineering, economics, or project management0-3 years relevant experienceExcellent Microsoft Excel skillsProactive and curiousStructured and analyticalInterest in product offerings and technical solutionsPeople skills, strong networking ability and a good team playerEffective verbal and written communication skills in EnglishMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of tasksA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker Care Access to welfare club with free gym facilities, sport equipment hires and cabins to rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from homeWe offer our Young Solutioneers an international employee network that brings together young talents for professional development, networking, and funInterested? Contact us.For more information about the position, please contact:Veslemøy Koppang, Recruiter, NES Advantage Solutions, mail: veslemoy.koppang@nesfircroft.com tel.: +47 406 48 686Applications will be evaluated continuously, so no need to wait until the deadline to apply.NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing service.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidates.Diversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

title: Principal Engineer - Materials Technology
description: We're 20,000 colleagues in more than 30 countries delivering oil, gas, wind and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. Taking on tough energy challenges is our job. Right now, we're facing an enormous task: supplying the world with the energy it needs, while lowering emissions.We're up for the challenge. Are you?The positionBy joining our team in Technology, Digital & Innovation you will have the opportunity to:Initiate, develop and execute research and development projects on materials technology.Focus areas are material integrity issues related to hydrogen storage and transport, to ammonia value chain and to carbon capture and storage.Provide specialist advisory services to Equinor operations and projects.Identify business needs, opportunities, and technology gaps in cooperation with internal and external stakeholders.Ensure that design and operational risks are identified and mitigated.Support our leading advisor on Metallic materials and welding.We are looking for candidates that can contribute to both research and technology development and specialist technical advisory services to various Equinor business areas.YouSome qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for:MSc or PhD within materials technology, mechanical engineering or similar. Relevant experience may compensate for formal qualifications.Extensive technical expertise on relevant fields, such as metallurgy or electro chemistry.Broad experience on materials technology from different business perspectives.Desire to learn and take on new challenges.Strong project management skills and capability to lead and motivate people.Excellent written and oral communication skills in English, Norwegian would be advantageous.General informationPlease attach copies of your CV, diplomas, certificates and grades in English or a Scandinavian language.Applications submitted without necessary attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated.If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript or other document describing subjects and grades completed to this point.Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.Why join us?At Equinor, we care about each other as much as our business. That's why we offer:Not just a job; a career. In Equinor, your development begins on day one. You will build your competence through a wide range of learning activities while being empowered to build your career across multiple disciplines and geographies. Our internal job market allows endless opportunities for development and growth within your own field or in other interesting and relevant areas for you.Attractive rewards. We offer a comprehensive benefits package with competitive salaries, global parental leave, variable pay schemes and a share savings plan.Wellness and work-life balance. Our employees' well-being is a priority. We recognise that for you to be the best version of yourself in the workplace, being able to collect your children, attend a class or simply enjoy social time can be invaluable. That's why we encourage you to make use of our flexible work arrangements.An inclusive culture. We believe embracing our differences makes us stronger. For us true inclusion means being able to bring your whole self to work, and for everyone to feel accepted and valued.For more information visit Equinor's website: https://www.equinor.com/

title: Do you believe technology is key to solving the climate change challenge?
description: Aker Carbon Capture is a dedicated carbon capture technology (CCUS) company that offers a reliable, field-proven and HSE-friendly way of removing emissions from industrial sources. Our patented solutions serve a range of carbon-emitting industries including cement, blue hydrogen, bio/waste-to-energy, refineries and steel. Through our portfolio of projects across Europe, we are mitigating the environmental cost of industrial activity for a cleaner, more sustainable future.Our market potential grows daily as a rising number of customers look to CCUS and our company to solve their emissions challenges. Aker Carbon Capture is one of the few companies globally that has extensive knowledge of the entire CCUS value chain. We have more than a dozen ongoing projects, from concept studies to large EPC, and are tackling our biggest challenge yet: delivering the ground-breaking carbon capture plant at the Norcem cement factory in Brevik, Norway. This will be the world's first CO2-capture facility at a cement plant.Are you ready to work with us to realise the enormous potential CCUS has in making a lasting, positive impact on our environment?The RoleAs our new Senior Electrical Engineer you will:Be responsible for the design of the electrical power systems in CCUS projects and studiesBe responsible for handling and solving of site queries in our CCUS projectsBe responsible for technical input to procurement of electrical power systems, including specification of equipment, bid evaluations and supplier follow-up including installation contractors.Coordinate and supervise multi-location teams of electrical engineers in CCUS projectsContribute to standardization and general effective execution of CCUS projectsWho are you?Self-driven and motivated individual, with passion to environmental projectsFlexible regarding work tasks and possible practical field work, as requiredBachelor's degree in Electrical engineering (or similar) with minimum 7 years of relevant experience from project workExperience with installation of electrical systems in process plantsYou have a multidisciplinary understanding with varied work performed both on layout and system related part of the disciplineExpertise in ISO, EN and other international codes and standards pertaining to electrical power systemsExperience with electrical power supply (MV & LV), electrical motors, MCC, LV frequency converters, cable systems (MV & LV), lighting systems and earthing & lightening systemsFluent in written and spoken EnglishWhy Aker Carbon Capture?Aker Carbon Capture represents a possibility to take an active role in the industrial energy transition. We believe carbon capture is essential to reach the goals of the Paris Agreement. The role is important in supporting Aker Carbon Capture to help the industry meet its carbon capture obligations. As our colleague, you will be given opportunities and responsibility to develop with our company. We can offer a dynamic and challenging environment in a growing ESG companyAker Carbon Capture is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.The job is preferably located in Oslo (Fornebu) but candidates from any other location with similar time zone are welcome to apply.Contact InformationPlease contact Julie Wannebo, Lead Recruiter, NES Advantage, e-mail: julie.wannebo@nesfircroft.com, tel +47 2396 65 35.We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will be conducting interviews with relevant candidates on a continuous basis.

title: Senior Commercial Analyst
description: Company DescriptionWhy Statkraft?Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.Job DescriptionYour department: Statkraft’s ambition is to grow in the wind, solar and hydro generation business throughout the Nordics. You will work within the Nordics – Market Liaison unit to represent the Nordics Business Area and our views towards our colleagues in M as well as support the rest of the Nordics organization.  As a Senior Commercial Analyst in the Nordics – Market Liaison unit, your tasks will include: Research and analysis of Nordics market views (includes Norway / Sweden) Understand Statkraft’s LPF’s (Long Term Price Forecast) views and be able to challenge them (if and where needed) Participate in revenue evaluations for assets in M&A processes related to operational assets in the Nordics Engage with experts within and outside the company on revenue-impacting factors Assess the underlying fundamentals driving the value of Statkraft’s asset portfolio analytically and qualitatively Support Development teams / strategy projects where needed Interfaces / Stakeholders: Various asset owners of BA Nordics & the Nordics Development Team Other teams under SVP Ownership and Portfolio including VP Portfolio Various teams in the M organization including but not limited to MA, ME, MR Various price forecasting teams within Statkraft QualificationsAbout you: We look for an experienced Senior Commercial Analyst with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes knowledge in: Excellent university degree in economics, engineering, or science Some years of experience within the energy industry Profound understanding of the dynamics of electricity markets and their impact on asset revenues Ability to translate complex analysis into concrete and easily understandable recommendations and actions Experience in leading projects and excellent communication and facilitation skills Proactive and independent way of working, high reliability, strong communication skills English language fluency is necessary, Norwegian language fluency is preferred. Additional InformationA career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities, and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. Challenged? For us the ideas of our committed and ambitious colleagues make the difference. If you want to share our passion for renewable energy and be a part of tomorrow’s energy world, please apply through our online application form. For further information please contact Hire Manager Dominique Farag at dominique.farag@statkraft.com.We evaluate applications for this role on a continuing basis, so please apply with your CV through our career pages as soon as possible Application deadline: 21 of August 2023.

title: Data Steward
description: Job DescriptionYou will be part of newly established unit Nordic Operations Platform focusing on digitalisation initiatives within Nordic Energy Market. Securing high quality data and striving for a data architecture that scales with business is key for the on-going digitalisation journey. Our department will help business with management and governance of data in our core system for Energy Data Management (EDM).As a Data Steward in the Digitalisation Office you’ll:Define, document, and communicate data governance policies for EDM to stakeholders and usersEnforce data governance policiesEstablish data standards and manage data definitions and meta dataInitiate and follow up on any data quality improvement initiatives in close collaboration with product ownerQualificationsWe look for experienced Data Steward with the essential skills to future-proof our business. That includes:Knowledge of SQLStrong analytical skillsProactive and independent way of working.Reliable team player with excellent communication skills.Relevant education in the area of Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.Minimum two years of work experience working hands-on with data management and/or governanceExperiences in these areas are also useful in your role:Knowledge about Energy market in NordicsAt Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. Norwegian language fluency is preferred.Additional InformationA career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including Linkedin Learning and inspiring leaderships program like IMDThe chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgroundsThe opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principlesMonetary childcare subsidy to support you and your familyA focus on fun outside of work, supported by various activity groups such as soccer, yoga, sailing, climbing, boxing, cabin rentals, and much moreGerman language courses for non-native speakersBeing part of a company proudly certified as a ‘Great Place to Work’Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.Application deadline: 1 September 2023 Location and travel: The position will be located at the head office in Oslo. Contact: For questions about the role, please contact Zhanna Voskoboynik, Head of Nordic Operation Platform at zhanna.voskoboynik@statkraft.com.

title: Help shape the future of energy
description: At Aker Solutions, we design, manage, and build some of the most complex energy projects in the world. We are committed to the transition and are at the leading edge of decarbonizing oil and gas and developing zero carbon energy. Building on our renowned front-end engineering skills, we are creating a world-class consultancy which will utilize the experience and data gathered from our early mover advantage in such areas as low carbon oil and gas, electrification, CCS, hydrogen and floating offshore wind to provide robust decision-making analysis and advice to our customers.We are now looking for a Senior Construction / Installation Method Engineer who wants to join our team and who can strengthen our capabilities in our Trondheim, Norway offices.In the developing energy mix, commercial risks are as prominent as technical risks, and our consultancy will provide broad multi-faceted advice to our customers. This developing market, coupled with an unprecedented demand for our execution experience, means that we are looking to grow our consultancy team with technical, consulting and commercially minded individuals who can help us meet the challenge of a just and orderly energy transition.What will you be doing?Be a part of a highly qualified Engineering teamDevelop your engineering abilities by working with highly skilled engineersTake responsibility for discipline deliverablesTechnical responsible for instrument design and activities for the assigned projectGather results together with offshore and onshore operatorsCooperate closely with vendors finding the optimal solutionSporadic offshore travelsActively participate in relevant process/ safety reviewsContribute to the development of methodology, tools, and competencyImplement field life solutions for our customersWork together with large clients within the energy industryWe think you should have:You are an experienced and engaged instrument engineer with 10 years + of experience from the energy sectorExperience in design of concept, project studies, FEED verification and detail designExtensive knowledge with international codes and standards required i.e. ASME, NORSOKSolution oriented with collaboration skillsIn-depth knowledge of relevant Norwegian regulations and standardsA commercial mindset, good communication skills and the ability to work both independently and as part of a teamStrong work ethics and a proactive attitudeThe ability to see solutions together and meet customer expectations and requirementsThe competency to be accurate, flexible, and organizedSolid command of Norwegian and English, both written and spokenMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projectsA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sport equipment hires and cabins to rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per weekThe opportunity to become a part of Young Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together young talents for professional development, networking, and funInterested? Contact us.General questions regarding the recruitment process can be addressed to:Randi Lund, Senior Recruiter, NES Advantage Solutions, Randi.Lund@nesfircroft.com - Mobil: 918 99 980Questions regarding technical tasks can be addressed to:Svein Bardal, Department Manager, Aker Solutions, Mobil: 92823032NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing services.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidates.Diversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

Building on our renowned front-end engineering skills, we are creating a world-class consultancy which will utilize the experience and data gathered from our early mover advantage in such areas as low carbon oil and gas, electrification, CCS, hydrogen and floating offshore wind to provide robust decision-making analysis and advice to our customers. We are now looking for a Specialist Method Engineer who wants to join our team and who can strengthen our capabilities within New Energy Consultancy.In the developing energy mix, commercial risks are as prominent as technical risks, and our consultancy will provide broad multi-faceted advice to our customers. This developing market, coupled with an unprecedented demand for our execution experience, means that we are looking to grow our consultancy team with technical, consulting and commercially minded individuals who can help us meet the challenge of a just and orderly energy transition.  What will you be doing?Be a part of a highly qualified Engineering team.Develop your engineering abilities by title: Are you up for a challenge?
description: At Aker Solutions, we design, manage, and build some of the most complex energy projects in the world. We are committed to the transition and are at the leading edge of decarbonizing oil and gas and developing zero carbon energy. Building on our renowned front-end engineering skills, we are creating a world-class consultancy which will utilize the experience and data gathered from our early mover advantage in such areas as low carbon oil and gas, electrification, CCS, hydrogen and floating offshore wind to provide robust decision-making analysis and advice to our customers.We are now looking for a Senior Structural Analysis Engineer who wants to join our Front End group at Fornebu. We are responsible for developing floating installations and our project ranging from early studies to FEED phase.In the developing energy mix, commercial risks are as prominent as technical risks, and our consultancy will provide broad multi-faceted advice to our customers. This developing market, coupled with an unprecedented demand for our execution experience, means that we are looking to grow our consultancy team with technical, consulting and commercially minded individuals who can help us meet the challenge of a just and orderly energy transition.What will you be doing?As our new Senior Structural Analysis Engineer, you will have the opportunity to be part of a strong team of 15 engineers with a long track-record of offshore floating structure. We develop products in the Oil & Gas segment ranging from semi-submersible platforms and into new products like offshore wind turbines, offshore fish farming, floating bridges.You will:Participate in concept, study and FEED projects in various positionsPerform structural analysesStrength and fatigue FE-analyses of offshore structures (SESAM)Global and local analyses for floating offshore structureBe part of the design development of global and local hull structuresProvide input to 3D models and 2D-drawingsSecure and complete quality control of design reports and drawingsCollaborate with other discipline within the groupWe think you should have:A master’s degree in structural engineering / naval architecture or similar. Relevant experience might compensate for lower formal educationMin 7 years’ experience with design and analyses of offshore structures to qualify for a senior positionExperience using FE-Analysis tools, such as Sesam / AbaqusAn innovative and creative approach to problem solvingA team spirit attitude, but at the same time be able to work individually and take responsibility for your own tasksThe ability to communicate effectively in English, both orally and in writingMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projectsA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sport equipment hires and cabins to rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per weekThe opportunity to become a part of Young Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together young talents for professional development, networking, and funInterested? Contact us.For more information about the position, please contact:Synøve Sørland, Team Lead permanent recruitment, NES Advantage Solutions, email: synove.sorland@nesfircroft.comNES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing services.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidates.Diversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce.
