title: Be a key member of the Global Demo team, supporting all of Cisco s customers.
description: Description:Position Description: Demonstration Sales Engineer/ Technology PresenterJob Location: Oslo, NorwayWhat is Oslo Experience Centre?The Oslo Experience Center is a collaboration focused experience centre located in the heart of Cisco´s collaboration technology development. The floors below center houses over 500 engineers responsible for developing everything from hardware, software, ringtones, mechanics, audio and quality assurance testing of our endpoints. Customers visiting Oslo Experience Center are mostly Fortune 500 companies. We are responsible for planning in person and virtual visits, hosting and presenting during the visit. We do a mix of discussions, presentations and demonstrations showcasing our products, and we invite our special guests in to the engineering site to experience some of the work involved with developing the endpoints.Team DescriptionJoin a dynamic team that is driving growth and adoption of Cisco Collaboration solutions into the market. Become part of the awesome Oslo Experience Centre team who are responsible for direct customer-facing services that enable sales and increase customers’ confidence to buy. In this role you will use deep technical understanding to create and provide first-class customer-facing experiences across audiences, services and functions. You will be a crucial part of a team that welcomes Cisco’s most important customers and partners from all over the world and helps close significant amounts of revenue for Cisco. What You’ll Do• Be a key member of the Global Demo team, supporting all of Cisco’s customers.• Deliver convincing presentations and demonstrations, both in person and virtually, using innovative and engaging techniques for Cisco’s customers and partners.• Design and develop new presentations and demonstrations and keep existing demonstration experiences current.• Ensure that the demonstration business story aligns with key marketing messaging.• Working closely with engineers that develop the solutions you will be presenting and demonstrating. Who You Are• You communicate clearly and effectively and have good English verbal and written skills• You are a natural presenter and enjoy speaking in front of a large audience.• You are passionate about helping companies make a difference by changing the way they work through powerful collaboration experiences.• You have a flexible mindset and are able to adapt to changes quickly.• You enjoy being challenged and think on your feet.• You are creative, have critical thinking skills, are curious, and obsessed with creating and delivering projects that truly impact our customers’ experience, as well as driving improvements in the centre.• You enjoy working in an agile environment and you like dealing with all kinds of people: from technical engineering teams to decision making CEO´s. Why CiscoWe believe that happy people can make anything happen and are proud to be #1 World´s Best Workplace in 2022. In addition to a competitive salary, and other benefits, we enjoy:• a Cisco Fun group – dedicated to creating great memories• a Cisco Play group – that organizes yoga and weekly bootcamps in our in-house fitness center – to strengthen your body and relieve your stress• our in-house Coffee Barista• free ice cream on warm summer days!Physical work site address Philip pedersensvei 1. 1366 Lysaker Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry.Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”

title: Cloud Developer (C#)
description: Job DescriptionIf you’re a skilled Cloud Developer with experience in Azure and C#, you can start a career that helps to solve the climate crisis, with Statkraft. You will be a key resource in the development of our cloud integration platform.Working in Integration and RPAWe are a specialist team responsible for delivering integration, data solutions and RPA to all business areas in Statkraft across the globe. Some examples are:Delivering customized integration solutions that connects the different business areas, business processes and systems that supports the whole value chain in StatkraftProcesses, structures, stores, and quality assure a huge amount of data every dayAutomating business processes and data harvesting with RPAOn a technical level, we deliver on a wide technology stack ranging from e.g. C#, Python, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure API Management, Azure Data Factory, BizTalk, UIPath and more.Integration, data, and RPA are essential for Statkraft to remain a market leader in renewable energy production, and we are now looking for great people to join our team. If you enjoy challenging yourself and working in a competitive industry where technology is evolving the business we operate in, then we would love to talk to you. If you are motivated by working for a company that is a key part of the solution for creating an environmentally sustainable society then Statkraft is the company for you.As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to work closely with business users in many parts of the company across the globe. As Cloud Developer in the Integration and RPA team, you’ll:Develop integrations in Azure with a solid focus on streamlining business processes, quality of work and innovationBe part of project work and migration of our on-prem integration platform to Azure servicesHelp Statkraft shape our digital foundation for the futureQualificationsWe look for experienced Cloud Developers with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes knowledge in:Good understanding and experience in the integration domainRelevant Azure experienceGood C# development skillsEager to learn more about new trends and technologiesFluent in English and preferably NorwegianExperiences in these areas are also useful in your role:Understanding of time seriesUnderstanding of the energy management, trading, or finance domainsExperience with Azure DevOpsAt Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to explore, learn, lead, teach and help others learn.What we offer A career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisationThe chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgroundsThe opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, and work life balance principlesStatkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.Relocation support if needed.Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorization. Location: Düsseldorf or Oslo.

title: Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?
description: At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future. We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?In August 2022, Aker Solutions entered into an agreement with SLB and Subsea 7 to form a new joint venture for subsea bringing subsea experts to deliver complete subsea and deep-water engineering solutions for the energy industry. The three companies will bring invaluable technical competence, geographical presence, robust portfolio and backlog projects, and skilled personnel with segment expertise to this agreement. This subsea integrated services venture will position itself to be a tier 1 company in the industry.The joint venture to come into effect in the second half of 2023 is subject to approval by the respective authorities of the concerned countries. Our Umbilical Team in Fornebu is now looking for a Project Engineer.What will you be doing?Manage and complete assigned tasks according to defined procedures and practicesDeliver OTQD (On Time Quality Delivery) engineering documentation according to Aker Solutions' practice, guidelines, and proceduresCoordinate correspondence to and from client and other contractorsCreate and maintain Materials and BoM’s in SAP and ensure relevant input is obtained and implementedProvide technical input to Lead engineer, procurement department, and umbilical manufacturing siteProvide technical support to sub-contractors and suppliersIdentify improvement opportunities and contribute to a continuous improvement cultureProactively gain and share knowledge/experience within team and departmentEnsure relevant Lessons Learnt are captured, understood and recorded as requiredWe think you should have:B.Sc or M.Sc. in relevant engineering discipline or 3 years relevant experienceExperience with engineering and project execution and a general understanding of the business areaExperience with SAP ERP system is an advantageGood technical, analytical, interpersonal and communication skillsAbility to work both as a team member and individuallyPlan and prioritize own activities and manage own workload with minimum supervisionStrong focus on quality and On Time Delivery when working under pressureExcellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills, building client relationsMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projects ranging from oil and gas, renewables (carbon capture, hydrogen, and offshore wind) to aqua cultureA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per week.Interested? Contact us.For more information about the position please contact:Rolf Erik Smith, Senior Advisor, NES Advantage Solutions, email: rolf.smith@nesfircroft.comApplications will be evaluated continuously, so no need to wait until the deadline to apply.NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing services.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidatesDiversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. title: Senior Investment Analyst in Scatec ASA
description: Senior Investment Analyst Want to join a frontrunner in renewable energy that is actively seeking early entry into new markets globally? Since the establishment in 2007, Scatec has acquired extensive knowledge and experience in developing, building and operating solar, wind and hydro power plants and storage solutions. Driven by our company values and competent global workforce, we aim to deliver competitive and sustainable renewable energy globally; protect our environment and improve quality of life through innovative integration of technology; and create shareholder value. We are present on four continents and are headquartered in Oslo, Norway. Main purpose of positionCurrently we are looking for a Senior Investment Analyst in Oslo, Norway to be part of our global team working together towards our vision – Improving our future. As our Senior Investment Analyst you will be involved in setting the Governance & Compliance and Investment Framework for the Scatec Group. You will also be involved in transaction management and quantitative analysis and quality review of material presented to executive management for our projects in development phase. The role acts also as an advisor for the group for financial analysis, developing corporate risk measures and structuring at group level. Finally, the role is part of the resource pool supporting other functions such as Regional Project Finance teams in obtaining project financing for Scatec’s project. Main responsibilities Perform investment analysis of various investment opportunities within renewableenergy, energy storage and hydrogen in emerging markets.Prepare investment decision material for Executive Management and Board of DirectorsSupport business areas with valuation and optimization analysisParticipate in M&A opportunities and due diligence processes.Contribute to development of investment framework, valuation methodology, modelling and communication.Be involved in developing further the Project Prioritization Framework including increasing data quality and automation.Participate in and develop the Aggregation of information (PDL) for input to MOR and monitoring of active region leads.Act as digital lead for the wide project finance organization and develop technology tools for more efficient information gathering and increase data quality.Validation and quality assurance of business cases Qualifications and competencies Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or similar University level education, commerce Degree or Engineering Degree with CA/CFA/MBA is an advantage3-5 years background in Project Finance, Structured Finance or M&A (Mergers and Acquisitions)Renewable Energy experience is an advantageExperience in complex financial modelling using MS ExcelExperience with PowerBI, Bloomberg and S&P toolsLanguage: fluent both written and spoken in EnglishOrganized and methodicalHigh social and intercultural competenceSelf-reliant, efficient and structured Personal characteristicsIt is part of every employees’ terms of reference to contribute to Scatec's vision: Improving our Future and adhere to our company values which are:Predictable: demonstrate clear communication and listening skills, shares information in an open and honest wayDriving results: demonstrate determination, pro-activeness, can prioritize and work independentlyChangemaker: demonstrate entrepreneurship, can challenge, fast learner, take initiates and adjustWorking together: demonstrate teamwork, shares responsibilities, can compromise, has a can-do attitudeWe offerScatec is an exciting, innovative and ambitious company operating in a growing industry. We offer a challenging and interesting position where you will be part of a flexible, diverse and truly international working environment consisting of highly competent and committed colleagues with a positive drive to make a difference. Scatec is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.Applications will be processed on a continuous basis.

Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?Aker Solutions has been awarded several large, long-term energy projects. title: Senior Risk Management Advisor - Corporate Project Management Office
description: Company DescriptionWhy Statkraft? Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.  Job DescriptionWorking in Statkraft Corporate Project Management Office  Corporate Project Management Office (PMO) supports business areas in Statkraft to deliver successful capital projects. To ensure efficient way of working, PMO strives for clear and standardized management processes based on project best practices, project training and lesson learned. PMO is responsible for Statkraft’s project model and facilitates project assurance activities.  We are a dedicated team, working across Statkraft by supporting capital projects in all geographies within all technologies (e.g. hydropower, wind, solar, batteries, hydrogen). To strengthen our team, we are looking for a team player with broad project experience, with special competence within project risk management.  You will be responsible for supporting a positive risk and quality improvement culture, underpinned by effective risk and quality frameworks. The position will establish and lead corporate wide project risk and quality network(s) as well as advise, facilitate, and monitor risk and quality activities and processes. You will report to Head of Corporate PMO. Your roleAs a Senior Advisor in PMO, your role will be to: Contribute and take on responsibility of specific tasks in further development, implementation and use of Statkraft’s project model with focus on risk management Take a leadership role in risk management for the development, enhancement and implementation of appropriate processes, requirements, guidelines and systems/tools. Promote understanding of risk and quality management, including delivery of training, as appropriate Facilitate project risk and quality activities and support project owners and project managers related to the decision gate processes Plan and perform risk assessments (qualitative and quantitative) Plan and perform project quality audits and reviews  Collect and analyse data and trends on aspects of quality and risk and report findings that stimulate continuous improvement Establish and lead risk network Participate in professional networks and forums appropriate to the role Support and advice project owners and project managers to ensure successful delivery of projects Travel to project sites/locations will be neededQualificationsMinimum Bachelor, preferably master’s degree in engineering, MBA or equivalent Demonstrated leadership experience as risk manager, project manager, program manager or project owner from development and/or infrastructure projects, preferable within the energy business, construction business or consultancy services Demonstrated teambuilding and interpersonal skills in international environments, cultural awareness Demonstrate clear communication skills, including digital platforms Self-starter and proactive with ability to work with commitment and accuracy under pressure with a high degree of self-motivation Additional InformationInterested? Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance. Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorization. For further information please contact Anders Falck Øien (andersfalck.oien@statkraft.com) or Øistein Aarnes (oistein.aarnes@statkraft.com)  We are flexible regarding location.  If you want to share our passion for renewable energy and be a part of tomorrow’s energy world, please apply with your CV and cover letter through our career pages. Application deadline: 1st of September 2023.

title: Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?
description: At Aker Solutions we are committed to helping the energy industry and broader society #PowerTheChange towards a low-carbon future. We are changemakers and problem solvers with more than 180 years of experience. Our ambitions are high. By 2030, renewables and low-carbon solutions for oil and gas will make up two-thirds of our business. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?Our new business segment Power Solutions are offering power systems and products from low to high voltage. This includes subsea substations, full hydropower electro-mechanical packages, control systems, and condition monitoring solutions for all renewable markets. We develop hydropower solutions, including expansion of existing technology, internally and through partnership. As part of our offerings, we deliver mid to large scale manufacturing service with associated engineering, ranging from R&D to defined products.Our Supply Chain Department is looking for a Logistics Coordinator Lead, having the responsibility for coordinating domestic & international shipments. You will be expected to work in close collaboration with both internal (Buyers, Project Managers and Product/Engineering) and external stakeholders (customers, suppliers and authorities). This gives you the opportunity to use your communications skills to build strong networks and to be a reliable team player.  What will you be doing?Be the main contact point for all logistic related mattersEnsure all shipping and customs documentation are handled accurately for all shipmentsSupport on topics related to customs, VAT and transport decisions in tender and execution of ProjectsFollow up customers and forwarders related to orders and transport matters for all our shipmentsAccountable for cost, schedule, and quality on all deliverables within your scopeEnsure all logistics data systems are continuously updatedCheck and approve all transport invoicesBuild, maintain and manage supplier relationships, and develop continuous improvement efforts within logistic and across the value chain to reduce overall cost, improve quality, shorten lead times, and improve on-time deliveryEnsure compliance to company guidelines, policies, and proceduresUnderstand and adhere to Clients Contractual requirementsWe think you should have:Bachelor’s degree in Logistics or similarRelevant work experience can compensate lack of formal educationMinimum 3 years relevant experienceExperience within logistics or transport planning in an international environmentExcellent team player skills to co-operate well with others, share knowledge, experience, information, and support others in the pursuit of team goalsStrong communication skills and master Norwegian and English fluently both written and orally.Analytical and structural approach to plan ahead and define clear prioritiesAbilities to work efficient under pressure and have high work capacityThe ability to act on own initiative, make things happen and be responsible for the resultsProficient knowledge of MS OfficeMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projects ranging from oil and gas, renewables (carbon capture, hydrogen, and offshore wind) to aqua cultureA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per weekWe have offices in Tranby, Fornebu and offer hybrid work solutions including the possibility to work from homeInterested? Contact us.For more information about the position, please contact:Cathinka Nielsen, Senior Advisor, NES Advantage Solutions, email: Cathinka.nielsen@nesfircroft.comOnly applicants with valid work visa / residence in Norway will be reviewed.NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing services.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidates.Diversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. Do you want to be a part of driving the transition?In August 2022, Aker Solutions entered into an agreement with SLB and Subsea 7 to form a new joint venture for subsea bringing subsea experts to deliver complete subsea and deep-water engineering solutions for the energy industry. The three companies will bring invaluable technical competence, geographical presence, robust portfolio and backlog projects, and skilled personnel with segment expertise to this agreement. This subsea integrated services venture will position itself to be a tier 1 company in the industry.The joint venture to come into effect in the second half of 2023 is subject to approval by the respective authorities of the concerned countries.We are now looking for a new role Procurement Tender Lead, being part of our direct procurement department. title: Business Analyst
description: Company DescriptionAre you looking to start a career as a Business Analyst? If you’ve got experience helping customers or organisations on their digitalisation journey, then you could help solve the climate crisis with Statkraft. This is your chance to drive internal digitalisation activities, realise the potential of renewable energy and make a positive impact on our planet.Why Statkraft?Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.Job DescriptionYou will be part of newly established unit Nordic Operations Platform focusing on digitalisation initiatives within Nordic Energy Market. Business Analyst in MRDN is a trusted advisor and energy market domain expert with great communication skills. Business analyst has ability to understand business challenges and needs and articulate them in problem statements. Business analyst has ability to consolidate and structure big amount of information and adapt it to target audience. Proactive and innovative in problem-solving.As a Business Analyst in the Digitalisation office, you’ll:Work with business and technical resources to identify business problems and develop the right approach to address the discovered problems.Proactively exploring digitalisation opportunities to support business strategic goals.Initiating and driving activities needed for further digitalisation of work processes.Collaborate with business and IT.QualificationsWe look for experienced Business Analyst with the essential skills to future-proof our business. That includes knowledge in:Hands-on experience in workshop facilitation, design thinking and agile ways of workingContinues improvement mind-set with proven resultsGood understanding of how Nordic Energy Market worksGreat communication skills both written and oralMinimum 4 years of relevant experience working with business requirements and stakeholder engagement.Experiences in these areas are also useful in your role:Knowledge and experience in modern product management and development frameworksAt Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to lead, teach and help others learn.Norwegian language fluency is preferred.Additional InformationA career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including Linkedin Learning and inspiring leaderships program like IMDThe chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgroundsThe opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principlesMonetary childcare subsidy to support you and your familyA focus on fun outside of work, supported by various activity groups such as soccer, yoga, sailing, climbing, boxing, cabin rentals, and much moreGerman language courses for non-native speakersBeing part of a company proudly certified as a ‘Great Place to Work’Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.Application deadline: 1 September 2023 Location and travel: The position will be located at the head office in Oslo. Contact: For questions about the role, please contact Zhanna Voskoboynik, Head of Nordic Operation Platform at zhanna.voskoboynik@statkraft.com.

This is NTNUNTNU is a broad-based university with a technical-scientific profile and a focus in professional education. The university is located in three cities with headquarters in Trondheim.At NTNU, 9,000 employees and 43,000 students work to create knowledge for a better world.You will find more information about working at NTNU and the application process here.   About the jobFor a position as a PhD Candidate, the goal is a completed doctoral education up to an obtained doctoral degree.This PhD position at the Department of Marine Technology is dedicated to the development of zero-carbon marine power systems based on hydrogen fuel. The position is connected to the Centre for environment-friendly energy research – FME HYDROGENi  as a cross-disciplinary effort between research areas “Transport and storage” and “Maritime end-use”. The research will be performed in collaboration with the project partners and other researchers at NTNU and SINTEF. Given the emerging and dynamic research field, the PhD scope may cover flexible research themes including both onboard power systems and port infrastructure, such as modeling and design of marine power and energy system, energy management and optimization for decarbonization, green port energy system, and smart hydrogen integration. The detailed scope of PhD will be defined based on the background and interest of the successful candidate.The position reports to the Head of Department.Duties of the positionPerform high-quality scientific research and publish the outcome through relevant channels.  Take part in laboratory and experimental activities.Be a cooperative member of the project team and collaborate with other project partners.Take part in joint research activities such as case studies, data collection and analysis.Required selection criteriaYou must have a professionally relevant background in one or more of the disciplines: marine technology, electrical engineering, control engineering/cybernetics, hybrid power and energy systems, hydrogen energy conversion, and optimization.Your education must correspond to a five-year Norwegian degree program, where 120 credits are obtained at master's level.You must have a strong academic background from your previous studies and an average grade from the master's degree program, or equivalent education, which is equal to B or better compared with NTNU's grading scale. If you do not have letter grades from previous studies, you must have an equally good academic basis. If you have a weaker grade background, you may be assessed if you can document that you are particularly suitable for a PhD education.Master's students can apply, but the master's degree must be obtained and documented by March 2024.You must meet the requirements for admission to the faculty's doctoral program (https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/phiv)Good English skills written and oral.The appointment is to be made in accordance with Regulations on terms of employment for positions such as postdoctoral fellow, Phd candidate, research assistant and specialist candidate and Regulations concerning the degrees of Philosophiae Doctor (PhD) and Philosodophiae Doctor (PhD) in artistic research national guidelines for appointment as PhD, post doctor and research assistant Preferred selection criteriaRelevant experience from industry and/or working in projects with multiple partners.Experimental/laboratory experience and interest.Experience with system modelling, analysis, and optimization.Personal characteristicsStrong analytical skills.Ability and motivation to work as part of a cross-disciplinary research team. The candidate is expected to expand his/her knowledge in other relevant fields.Good communication skills, positive attitude, and interest in teamwork.Emphasis will be placed on personal and interpersonal qualities.We offerExciting and stimulating tasks in a strong international academic environment.An open and inclusive work environment with dedicated colleagues.Favourable terms in the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund.Employee benefitsSalary and conditionsAs a PhD candidate (code 1017) you are normally paid from gross NOK 532 200 per annum before tax, depending on qualifications and seniority. From the salary, 2% is deducted as a contribution to the Norwegian Public Service Pension Fund.The period of employment is 3 years.Appointment to a PhD position requires that you are admitted to the PhD programme in Engingeering within three months of employment, and that you participate in an organized PhD programme during the employment period.--------------------------------The engagement is to be made in accordance with the regulations in force concerning State Employees and Civil Servants, and the acts relating to Control of the Export of Strategic Goods, Services and Technology. Candidates who by assessment of the application and attachment are seen to conflict with the criteria in the latter law will be prohibited from recruitment to NTNU. After the appointment you must assume that there may be changes in the area of work.It is a prerequisite you can be present at and accessible to the institution daily.About the applicationThe application and supporting documentation to be used as the basis for the assessment must be in English.Publications and other scientific work must be attached to the application. Please note that your application will be considered based solely on information submitted by the application deadline. You must therefore ensure that your application clearly demonstrates how your skills and experience fulfil the criteria specified above.The application must include: CV and certificates.Transcripts and diplomas for bachelor's and master's degrees. If you have not completed the master's degree, you must submit a confirmation that the master's thesis has been submitted.A copy of the master's thesis (if available). If you recently have submitted your master's thesis, you can attach a draft of the thesis. Documentation of a completed master's degree must be presented before taking up the position.Name and contact information of three referees.Publications or other relevant research work. (if you have)If all, or parts, of your education has been taken abroad, we also ask you to attach documentation of the scope and quality of your entire education, both bachelor's and master's education, in addition to other higher education. Description of the documentation required can be found here. If you already have a statement from NOKUT, please attach this as well.We will take joint work into account. If it is difficult to identify your efforts in the joint work, you must enclose a short description of your participation.In the evaluation of which candidate is best qualified, emphasis will be placed on education, experience and personal and interpersonal qualities. Motivation, ambitions, and potential will also count in the assessment of the candidates. NTNU is committed to following evaluation criteria for research quality according to The San Francisco Declaration on Research Assessment - DORA.General informationWorking at NTNUNTNU believes that inclusion and diversity is our strength. We want to recruit people with different competencies, educational backgrounds, life experiences and perspectives to contribute to solving our social responsibilities within education and research. We will facilitate for our employees’ needs.NTNU is working actively to increase the number of women employed in scientific positions and has a number of resources to promote equality. -----------------The city of Trondheim is a modern European city with a rich cultural scene. Trondheim is the innovation capital of Norway with a population of 200,000. The Norwegian welfare state, including healthcare, schools, kindergartens and overall equality, is probably the best of its kind in the world. Professional subsidized day-care for children is easily available. Furthermore, Trondheim offers great opportunities for education (including international schools) and possibilities to enjoy nature, culture and family life and has low crime rates and clean air quality.----------------------As an employee at NTNU, you must at all times adhere to the changes that the development in the subject entails and the organizational changes that are adopted.A public list of applicants with name, age, job title and municipality of residence is prepared after the application deadline. If you want to reserve yourself from entry on the public applicant list, this must be justified. Assessment will be made in accordance with current legislation. You will be notified if the reservation is not accepted.If you have any questions about the position, please contact Prof. Mehdi Zadeh, email mehdi.zadeh@ntnu.no. If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please contact Marit Gjersvold, e-mail: marit.gjersvold@ntnu.no.If you think this looks interesting and in line with your qualifications, please submit your application electronically via jobbnorge.no with your CV, diplomas and certificates attached. Applications submitted elsewhere will not be considered. Upon request, you must be able to obtain certified copies of your documentation.  Application deadline: 24.08.2023.

Background for the positionThe Computational Geosciences and Modelling group is seeking up two (2) new researchers in reservoir simulation for subsurface resources. Reservoir simulation is an essential component to our existing research program within CO2 storage, subsurface H2 storage and petroleum production. Development of new simulation technology within the OPM Flow reservoir simulator is central to maintaining a leading position within these rapidly growing research topics.Department information:NORCE Energy is a department at the Technology division of NORCE Norwegian Research Centre AS conducting interdisciplinary research within energy resources. The department has close to 200 scientific employees, organized into 8 groups, and has offices in Bergen, Stavanger, Kristiansand and Oslo. Research activity in the department has a particular focus on energy savings for the petroleum industry, and geological carbon utilization and storage (CCUS). The department is also building a project portfolio within renewable energy sources, energy systems, and energy storage, and has ambitions to increase the research portfolio in these domains significantly the coming years.About the positionThe position will be linked to the research group Computational Geosciences and Modelling. This group is a world leader in simulation and modeling within petroleum and CCUS research. The group currently has 12 researchers with background in mathematics, physics, and software development. The group works closely with the industry and other research institutions, both nationally and internationally, and has a tradition of taking the research all the way to practical application.A key part of the research group’s activities centers around the Open Porous Media initiative (OPM), a collaborative open-source software development project in industry-standard reservoir simulation. NORCE is a key developer of OPM Flow with focus on CO2 storage, CO2-EOR, Hydrogen and traditional petroleum reservoir simulation. The group seeks to apply modeling and simulation expertise towards emerging applications in within energy, climate and the environment.The primary research tasks will be oriented towards ongoing projects for example:Centre for Sustainable Subsurface Resources (CSSR): is a national centre for petroleum research (PETROSENTER), led by NORCE in collaboration with the University of Bergen that receives funding from the Norwegian Research Council and industry stakeholders. CSSR is a long-term prestigious research centre dedicated to providing new subsurface knowledge and digital solutions to drastically reduce Norway’s offshore emissions. A key activity in CSSR is developing models and implementation of computational tools for cycling or intermittent flows with application to underground energy storage, CO2 storage, variable water injection for hydrocarbon recovery. The group is also active in developing new multi-complexity simulation approaches for reservoir management.ExpReCCS: a Collaborative and Knowledge-building Project (KSP) financed by The Research Council of Norway, Equinor, Wintershall DEA and Shell Norge. The main objective of the project is to enable multi-site storage development on the Horda Platform and support risk-reduction activities and portfolio management strategies through improved regional simulation of interconnected storage sites and innovative assessment of system level uncertainty.Other relevant projects in underground hydrogen storage and CCS within the group’s portfolioAs well, the position will contribute to development of new initiatives in CO2 storage and hydrogen storage research projectsResponsibilities and work tasksOur new colleague will be part of teams for both ongoing projects and applications to national and regional research funds, and the EU. Work tasks will be mainly focused on model development, implementation, testing and execution of simulation studies. Project task will be varied, from mainly research-driven activities to more applied tasks in connection with industry projects. You will have the opportunity to develop new ideas and solutions in an environment which creates value for both society and businesses.The candidate is expected to:Contribute with programming expertise in the OPM framework to carry out diverse project activitiesPublish in relevant journalsCollaborate both internally and externallyParticipate in national/international scientific workshops, seminars, and conferencesContribute to group activities such as internal seminars, dissemination and communicationRequired skills, expertise and experienceThe candidate should hold a doctorate / PhD in applied mathematics, physics, engineering or related field.The candidate must have experience in modeling and simulation of fluid flow and coupled processes in porous media at the continuum scale.Documented experience in programming within the OPM framework, which includes OPM simulators, OPM models, and/or DUNE environment is an advantage.Experience with software development in other environments such as MRST, PorePy or DuMuX is an advantage.It is an advantage to be able to communicate orally in Norwegian in addition to excellent oral and written English skills.We offer:Depending on the experience and qualifications of the candidates, we will consider offering temporary postdoctoral position or permanent researcher position. Exceptional candidates will be offered a senior researcher or higher.Exciting tasks and good colleagues in an internationally leading and recognized professional environmentCollaboration with staff and students at universities and collegesOpportunities to create exciting projects and expand your network together with NORCEInterdisciplinary work in teams together with experts who complement your own area of   expertiseGood opportunities for professional and personal development in an organization that values   good performanceVaried and flexible working dayHow to applyYour application must includeA motivation letter describing (research) interests and relevant experienceCV (including list of publications)Copies of diplomasName and contact information of at least 2 referencesContact person: Sarah Gasda, e-mail: sgas@norceresearch.no, Job title: Research Director, Phone: +47 90508106Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Furthermore, one can expect that background checks can be conducted on all final candidates who may be checked against relevant lists to ensure compliance with applicable export control and sanctions rules. Candidates will be asked to provide information about affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment.Application deadline: 31.08.2023

description: Business Development ManagerWe are searching for a motivated and skilled employee with a background from complex systems and driving sales / business development related activities. The position reports to the Alkaline After Sales and Service Director and the role is based in one of the following locations: Notodden, Porsgrunn/Herøya, Kristiansand, Trondheim or Oslo.Main tasks title: International Trainee Programme - Finance
description: Are you looking to kick-start your career as a trainee in Europe`s largest renewables company? Statkraft’s International Trainee programme gives you the opportunity to be surrounded by and learn from smart people who care about their work positively impacting the green energy transition. We are now recruiting three Finance positions based in Oslo.Statkraft’s International Trainee Programme is a great introduction to working life. You will spend 16 months learning and developing yourself alongside other graduates and start your career in renewables. The programme consists of three job rotations across the company, of which at least one will be abroad. As a trainee, you will participate in various professional development courses and gatherings to acquire new skills and share experiences. You will also get the opportunity to apply for a seat on our CEO-led Future Board initiative – an advisory board made up of trainees and young professionals in Statkraft. Commercial, portfolio and regulatory –Investment Analyst Trainee Hydrogen, OsloThe Commercial, Portfolio and Regulatory unit in the hydrogen organization is a growing team of ~10 employees. We ensure that Statkraft can assess and select the right hydrogen projects, find the right partners, and acquisition opportunities to achieve our hydrogen ambitions, deliver optimal solutions for our hydrogen customers, and have the knowledge of the hydrogen market and regulation to make the right decisions and influence our environment. We work in close cooperation with the asset owners and will in many cases work as an integrated part of the hydrogen project development teams.We will work closely together with all parts of Statkraft involved in hydrogen development. Statkraft has their main hydrogen activities in the European markets such as Nordics, UK, Germany, Netherlands, but we will also provide support and sparring for new markets for Statkraft hydrogen activities such as the international markets India, Brazil and Chile.Responsibilities:Core responsibility of the role is to develop and maintain the business case and valuations for Statkraft’s hydrogen projects. This will involve the following:Develop and maintain the business case and valuation model for hydrogen projects and drive the financial optimization of projects – as an integrated part of the hydrogen project development teamsContribute to developing and maintaining an overview of valuation input parametersEnsure up-to-date and aligned input parameters are applied in the valuation models for hydrogen projectsOwn or contribute to the development of the hydrogen valuation model and methodology in StatkraftParticipate in investment and transaction support for acquisitions, partnerships, and sell-downs of hydrogen projects. This will include conducting the valuation of the project, support in negotiations, and lead or support development of initial target assessmentSupport in developing bids for public support schemes (e.g. CfD systems)Leverage Statkraft expertise and insight to analyse and optimize revenue and power costs of Statkraft’s hydrogen projectsContribute to the development of hydrogen purchase agreements (HPA)Advise on commercial aspects of the hydrogen portfolio across Statkraft’s markets with hydrogen activities Junior Business Developer – Nordic Hydrogen, OsloAs a trainee in the Nordic hydrogen department, you will work closely with one of the business developers and their project team and get the opportunity to learn all key aspects of project development.Responsibility:Support the team to develop a portfolio of hydrogen-related projects in the Nordics from early-phase ideas through to construction and operationAnalyze the market and regulatory conditions to assess the potential for hydrogen-related projectsCollaborate with technical, commercial and project management teams to ensure that the projects progress in Statkraft’s project development governance system  Financial Advisor, Financial reporting and Controlling, OsloOur modern Finance function is at the core of our business, helping to inform the major decisions that impact our projects and activities, and funding the world’s transition to a greener energy future. Our Finance employees are highly valued business partners with strategic and operational focus and are the catalyst for driving our business transformation.The departments is responsible for regulatory compliance reporting, performance management, financial reporting and for all finance operations on some of our global locations. We have people working in the offices in Norway, Germany, Brazil and the US. We are searching for a trainee that will work in the two finance areas of financial reporting, global market operations and performance management.  Responsibility:Support ensuring compliance with IFRS Accounting policies, group financial reporting requirements for entities belonging to the segmentYou will drive improvements in methodologies, systems and processes within the core activities for Financial Reporting and Internal ControlsSupport on developing and report on the segments performance management key indicatorsLearn about the Market activities within different roles and locationsQualifications We need new graduates who are motivated to be part of the green transition and welcome individuals from different backgrounds that want to help change the world with us. Statkraft is looking for trainees with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions that includes:  Master’s degree within relevant area, e.g., business, finance, industrial economics, auditing, accounting or similarNo more than one year of work experience post education (excluding internships/part-time jobs) Strong and proven ability to collaborate with others and work as a team playerCurious and open minded towards different tasks and work environments Open to relocate during your trainee program for a period of 6 monthsFluency in English is required (fluency in other European languages would be an asset)To apply please attach your CV and transcripts within the application deadline 23rd of September 2023. All applications will be processed after the deadline.Please be available for the Assessment Center in Week 41 and 42 (specific dates will be shared).Trainee Program start date: 1st of September 2024.For questions, please reach out to trainee@statkraft.com, and we will handle your request as soon as possible. Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorization. Learn more about our International Trainee Program on our website, www.statkraft.com/trainee.

title: Technical Specialist - Clean Energy
description: Join our clean energy team to enable the energy transition! HLNGs history of innovative and new solutions dates back more than 50 years when the LNG carrier Norman Lady was ordered in 1969 as the first Moss type LNG tanker. Building on our history as pioneers and innovators we are working to implement carbon reduction technology and clean energy solutions. Together with clients and partners we are developing solutions utilising our expertise in regasification and FSRU technology and applying them to infrastructure solutions for clean, carbon-free energy. Currently, this includes floating ammonia terminal solutions, ammonia to hydrogen, blue hydrogen production and CCS solutions.  The purpose of floating ammonia terminals is the import and storage of liquid ammonia, the export of ammonia and / or hydrogen to shore. Among other initiatives, Höegh LNG is participating in a development project for an industrial-scale ammonia cracker to be placed on a floating terminal for the supply of hydrogen to end-consumers.  As part of the future ammonia value chain, floating ammonia terminals can be utilized to reload the cargo for further distribution within a region, and to process the received cargo to provide clean energy to local markets. The benefits of a floating solution compared to an onshore solution are: minimal space required onshore, cost savings, faster project execution, flexibility as the facility can be relocated and easier permitting. Höegh LNG has developed a maritime CCS value chain based on low pressure solution and holds the IP rights for the design and approval in principle from DNV. The concept is based on a CO2 Floating Collection Storage Offloading (FCSO) moored to shore which receives and processes the CO2. The liquified CO2 is shipped from the FCSO and injected offshore at the field. Clean Energy Technical SpecialistThe Clean Energy Technical Specialist will develop clean energy solutions, such as ammonia to hydrogen projects, blue hydrogen production and CCS projects. The Technical Specialist is part of the team for technology and solutions supporting the clean energy strategy. The position will also extensively interact with external technical contacts and research organizations. Typical areas to work with Develop technical solution for Clean Energy in accordance with the strategyProvide technical expertise and knowledge in the execution of the clean energy strategyEvaluation of merit and attraction of various technical and operational solutions in the development of new clean energy business opportunitiesBuilding relationships with external technical and research counterpartiesParticipate as Company representative in external projects related to clean energyEstablish and nurture relationships with new and existing business partnersDevelopment and documentation of internal expertise in clean energy technology QualificationsMasters degree in process or marine engineeringDifferent educational background combined with very relevant experience can be consideredMinimum 9-10 years experiencePreferably experience from Clean Energy solutionsProficiency in EnglishPersonal qualities You are innovative and willing to challenge the current way of thinkingYou are open minded, forward thinking, positive and eager to learnYou possess energy, drive and are curiousYou are a team-player, but also demonstrate the ability to work independentlyYou work efficiently and achieve results on timeYou possess excellent communication and analytics skillsAble and willing to adapt and function in diverse situations with diverse business cultures on all continents   Background checks: To uphold our organisation's security and integrity standards, we conduct rigorous background checks on potential hires during the final recruitment stages.  At HLNG we champion equal opportunities and eagerly await applications from all qualified candidates.

title: Commercial Concept Developer - Clean Energy
description: Join our clean energy team to enable the energy transition! HLNGs history of innovative and new solutions dates back more than 50 years when the LNG carrier Norman Lady was ordered in 1969 as the first Moss type LNG tanker. Building on our history as pioneers and innovators we are working to implement carbon reduction technology and clean energy solutions. Together with clients and partners we are developing solutions utilising our expertise in marine gas handling technology and applying them to infrastructure solutions for clean, carbon-free energy. Currently, this includes floating ammonia terminal solutions, ammonia to hydrogen, blue hydrogen production and CCS solutions.  The purpose of floating ammonia terminal is the import and storage of liquid ammonia, the export of ammonia and / or hydrogen to shore. Among other initiatives, Höegh LNG is participating in a development project for an industrial-scale ammonia cracker to be placed on a floating terminal for the supply of hydrogen to end-consumers.  As part of the future ammonia value chain, floating ammonia terminals can be utilized to reload the cargo for further distribution within a region, and to process the received cargo to provide clean energy to local markets. The benefits of a floating solution compared to an onshore solution are: minimal space required onshore, cost savings, faster project execution, flexibility as the facility can be relocated and easier permitting. Höegh LNG has developed a maritime CCS value chain based on low pressure solution and holds the IP rights for the design and approval in principle from DNV. The concept is based on a Floating Collection Storage Offloading (FCSO) moored to shore which receives and process the CO2. The liquified CO2 is shipped from the FCSO and injected offshore at the field.Clean Energy Commercial Concept DeveloperThe Clean Energy Concept Developer will develop and commercialise clean energy solutions, such as ammonia to hydrogen projects and CCS projects. This implies bridging the new technical solutions to commercially viable services in cooperation with our customers. This includes following up all early stage leads to ascertain whether the lead may turn into a real project and determining whether this may be an interesting business case for Höegh LNG. The work will be done in close cooperation with the regional business development teams and internal technical expertise. Typical areas to work with Develop and maintain business relationships with prospective customers and partnersDevelop Clean Energy projectsDevelop Clean Energy technology to commercial solutionsLead the Clean Energy activities and contract negotiations for prioritised projectsMarketing of Clean Energy solutions and promote HLNG in conferences and exhibitionsProvide input and be part of implementation of strategic initiativesQualifications Master Degree in Business or TechnologyDifferent educational background combined with very relevant experience can be consideredMinimum 9-10 years experience from offshore oil & gas, FPSOs, LNG industry and/or shippingProficiency in English.Personal qualities You are innovative and willing to challenge the current way of thinkingYou are open minded, forward thinking, positive and eager to learnYou possess energy, drive and are curiousYou are a team-player, but also demonstrate the ability to work independentlyYou work efficiently and achieve results on timeYou possess excellent communication and analytics skillsYou have a commercial mindset used to identify and develop solutions that add value to the company and clients.Able and willing to adapt and function in diverse situations with diverse business cultures on all continents.   Background checks: To uphold our organisation's security and integrity standards, we conduct rigorous background checks on potential hires during the final recruitment stages.  At HLNG, we champion equal opportunities and eagerly await applications from all qualified candidates.

title: Do you want to play a role in solving global energy challenges for future generations?
description: At Aker Solutions, we design, manage, and build some of the most complex energy projects in the world. We are committed to the transition and are at the leading edge of decarbonizing oil and gas and developing zero carbon energy. Building on our renowned front-end engineering skills, we are creating a world-class consultancy which will utilize the experience and data gathered from our early mover advantage in such areas as low carbon oil and gas, electrification, CCS, hydrogen and floating offshore wind to provide robust decision-making analysis and advice to our customers. We are now looking for a Market Consultant ECR Hydrogen & CO2 who wants to join our team in Fornebu.In the developing energy mix, commercial risks are as prominent as technical risks, and our consultancy will provide broad multi-faceted advice to our customers. This developing market, coupled with an unprecedented demand for our execution experience, means that we are looking to grow our consultancy team with technical, consulting and commercially minded individuals who can help us meet the challenge of a just and orderly energy transition.What will you be doing? Deliver on own studies:Scope of WorkBudgetScheduleBuild client trust for study/client portfolioFollow up studies in portfolio:Performance – technical and economicalClient satisfactionAreas of concernActive participation (workshops / review)Participate in sales activities and presentationsSupport market lead on:Tender coordinationTender developmentTender reviewDeputy for market lead We think you should have: Minimum 5 - 10 years of experience form the energy sector with a techical background. Proven leadership skillsProven track record from study management and consultancy workProven knowledge from Hydrogen and CO2 value chain studies and projectsBroad network within the energy sectorExcellent communication skillsMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projects ranging from oil and gas, renewables (carbon capture, hydrogen and offshore wind) to aqua cultureA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your life journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sports equipment hire and cabins for rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per weekInterested? Contact us.For more information about the position please contact: Rolf Erik Smith, Senior Advisor, NES Advantage Solutions,email; rolf.smith@nesfircroft.comApplications will be evaluated continuously, so no need to wait until the deadline to apply.NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing services.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidatesDiversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

title: Vil du bli med i et team av ingeniører i verdensklasse?
description: Ønsker du å være en del av spennende og meningsfulle prosjekter, hvor du kan utforske komplekse problemstillinger? Vi har den ideelle rollen for deg som ønsker å sette ditt unike preg på energibransjen!Citec Norway er en del av Cyient, et stort internasjonalt selskap innen digitale løsninger, ingeniørvirksomhet og teknologi, har mer enn 17.000 svært kvalifiserte ansatte globalt. Av disse er 40 lokalisert i Norge. Vi samarbeider tett med våre kunder for å designe digitale virksomheter, utvikle intelligente produkter og plattformer, og løse utfordringer knyttet til bærekraft. Vår lokale tilstedeværelse gjenspeiler vår forpliktelse til å designe morgendagen i samarbeid med interessentene våre, og vi streber etter å være en kulturelt inkluderende, sosialt ansvarlig og miljømessig bærekraftig organisasjon.På lokalt plan er Citec Norway engasjert i en rekke prosjekter innen hydrogen, karbonfangst, LNG og olje og gass. Vår lange tradisjon med å optimalisere energiprosesser bidrar til å gjøre disse sektorene mer effektive. Vi ser på den grønne omstillingen som en ideell match for vår ekspertise, og vi er fast bestemt på å fortsette å støtte en bærekraftig fremtid gjennom vårt arbeid.Vi opplever økt etterspørsel og ønsker derfor å styrke selskapet med flere dyktige, erfarne medarbeidere innen ulike fagområder.Vi søker etter en erfaren prosjektleder til vårt kontor på Lysaker. Det er ønskelig at kandidater har 5-10 års relevant erfaring, men kvalifiserte kandidater med kortere eller lengre erfaring vil også bli vurdert.Du blir tilbudtInteressant og utfordrende prosjektarbeid, inn- og utlandInternasjonalt arbeidsmiljø i et voksende selskapProfesjonell utvikling samt muligheten til å ta fatt på mer krevende oppgaverDyktige kolleger og hyggelig atmosfæreFleksible arbeidstider med hybrid arbeidsmodellKonkurransedyktige vilkår med svært gode pensjons- og forsikringsordningerSom om ikke det er nok, hør hva Anders sier om det å starte i Citec:I Citec ble jeg en del av et inkluderende team med høy kompetanse. Jeg har blitt utfordret med mange spennende arbeidsoppgaver og fått mulighet til å jobbe med mange spennende kunder og prosjekter knyttet til det grønne skiftet. title: Vil du bli med i et team av ingeniører i verdensklasse?
description: Ønsker du å være en del av spennende og meningsfulle prosjekter, hvor du kan utforske komplekse problemstillinger? Vi har den ideelle rollen for deg som ønsker å sette ditt unike preg på energibransjen!Citec Norway er en del av Cyient, et stort internasjonalt selskap innen digitale løsninger, ingeniørvirksomhet og teknologi, har mer enn 17.000 svært kvalifiserte ansatte globalt. Av disse er 40 lokalisert i Norge. Vi samarbeider tett med våre kunder for å designe digitale virksomheter, utvikle intelligente produkter og plattformer, og løse utfordringer knyttet til bærekraft. Vår lokale tilstedeværelse gjenspeiler vår forpliktelse til å designe morgendagen i samarbeid med interessentene våre, og vi streber etter å være en kulturelt inkluderende, sosialt ansvarlig og miljømessig bærekraftig organisasjon.På lokalt plan er Citec Norway engasjert i en rekke prosjekter innen hydrogen, karbonfangst, LNG og olje og gass. Vår lange tradisjon med å optimalisere energiprosesser bidrar til å gjøre disse sektorene mer effektive. Vi ser på den grønne omstillingen som en ideell match for vår ekspertise, og vi er fast bestemt på å fortsette å støtte en bærekraftig fremtid gjennom vårt arbeid.Vi opplever økt etterspørsel og ønsker derfor å styrke selskapet med én eller flere dyktige, erfarne medarbeidere innen rørdesign/layout på vårt kontor på Lysaker.Vi ser etter kandidater med 5-10 års relevant erfaring, men sterke kandidater med kortere eller lengre erfaring vil også bli vurdert.Du blir tilbudtInteressant og utfordrende prosjektarbeid, inn- og utlandInternasjonalt arbeidsmiljø i et voksende selskapProfesjonell utvikling samt muligheten til å ta fatt på mer krevende oppgaverDyktige kolleger og hyggelig atmosfæreFleksible arbeidstider med hybrid arbeidsmodellKonkurransedyktige vilkår med svært gode pensjons- og forsikringsordningerSom om ikke det er nok, hør hva Anders sier om det å starte i Citec:I Citec ble jeg en del av et inkluderende team med høy kompetanse. Jeg har blitt utfordret med mange spennende arbeidsoppgaver og fått mulighet til å jobbe med mange spennende kunder og prosjekter knyttet til det grønne skiftet. I Citec har jeg raskt fått ansvar og mulighet til å utvikle min egen kompetanse.Arbeidsoppgaver3D-modellering i PDMS, E3D eller AutoCAD Plant 3DKonseptvurdering og utviklingRørstyrkeanalyse i CAESAR IIProsjektarbeid i tverrfaglige teamAktiv deltakelse i layout-designgjennomganger, HAZOP osv.Vi søker deg somHar utdannelse på bachelor eller masternivå innen maskin- eller andre relevante ingeniørfagHar eErfaring med 3D-modellering (innen hydrogen, karbonfangst, LNG, olje og gass eller annen anleggsindustri)Har god kjennskap til relevante forskrifter, inkludert ASME, EN, DNV og NORSOKHar utmerkede kommunikasjonsevner på norsk og engelsk, skriftlig og muntligFor å lykkes i rollen er det avgjørende at du har gode samarbeids- og lederegenskaper. Du liker å ta ansvar og er strukturert i ditt arbeid, samt opptatt av å oppfylle kvalitetsstandard som trengs for arbeidet.Vår rekrutteringsprosessDenne rekrutteringsprosessen håndteres av Academic Work og det er vår kundes ønske at alle spørsmål om stillingen rettes til Academic Work.Vår utvelgelsesprosess er kontinuerlig og annonsen kan lukkes før rekrutteringsprosessen er fullført dersom vi har gått videre til neste fase. Prosessen inkluderer to tester: en personlighetstest og en kognitiv test. Testene er verktøy for å finne rett talent til rett stilling, for å muliggjøre likestilling, mangfold og en rettferdig prosess.
