title: Principal Researcher   Gas Conversion Technology
description: We're 20,000 colleagues in more than 30 countries delivering oil, gas, wind and solar power to 170 million people worldwide. Taking on tough energy challenges is our job. Right now, we're facing an enormous task: supplying the world with the energy it needs, while lowering emissions.We're up for the challenge. Are you?The positionBy joining our team in Technology, Digital & Innovation you will have the opportunity to:Deliver as part of the Low carbon value chains (LCVC) team. The team delivers research, technology development projects and specialist services towards the low-carbon value chains.Develop and qualify technology solutions and perform specialist services within low carbon value chains, mainly Hydrogen and Ammonia.Follow up development and implementation of new technology with our internal and external partners.Contribute to shaping our future and setting direction for tomorrows technology development portfolio.Develop your competence in challenging tasks and work together with highly qualified colleagues in an inspiring and caring work environment.YouSome qualities are essential for Equinor. You identify with our values, open, collaborative, courageous and caring, which guide our decisions and help us succeed and grow. You make safety your priority and contribute to our zero-harm culture. For this position, we are also looking for:MSc or PhD education within Chemistry or Engineering, with 5-15 years relevant experience within downstream processing, and/or Hydrogen/Ammonia production.Specialization within process simulations, gas conversion, synthesis gas.Experience with process simulators.Team player with the ability to work independently in a multi-disciplinary environment on multiple locations.Ability to lead and take responsibility for project deliveries.Curious and stakeholder driven mindset.General informationPlease attach copies of your CV, diplomas, certificates and grades in English or a Scandinavian language.Through this link you can find important information on what to include in your CV, which will make the application process easier and faster.Applications submitted without necessary attachments will unfortunately not be evaluated.If you are in the process of completing a degree, please upload an official temporary transcript or other document describing subjects and grades completed to this point.Candidates are expected to openly offer all relevant information about themselves during the recruitment process. Candidates will be asked for information on affiliation to high-risk countries for a security assessment. Furthermore, background checks are performed on all final candidates and all permanent and temporary hires will be screened against relevant sanctions lists to ensure compliance with sanctions law.Why join us?At Equinor, we care about each other as much as our business. That's why we offer:Not just a job; a career. In Equinor, your development begins on day one. You will build your competence through a wide range of learning activities while being empowered to build your career across multiple disciplines and geographies. Our internal job market allows endless opportunities for development and growth within your own field or in other interesting and relevant areas for you.Attractive rewards. We offer a comprehensive benefits package with competitive salaries, global parental leave, variable pay schemes and a share savings plan.Wellness and work-life balance. Our employees' well-being is a priority. We recognise that for you to be the best version of yourself in the workplace, being able to collect your children, attend a class or simply enjoy social time can be invaluable. That's why we encourage you to make use of our flexible work arrangements.An inclusive culture. We believe embracing our differences makes us stronger. For us true inclusion means being able to bring your whole self to work, and for everyone to feel accepted and valued.For more information visit Equinor's website: https://www.equinor.com/

title: SINTEF Energi søker forskere og seniorforskere
description: Vil du være med å forme framtidens energiløsninger?   SINTEF er et av Europas største forskningsinstitutt. I over 70 år har vi bidratt til innovasjoner og løsninger for samfunnet og våre kunder. SINTEFs visjon er Teknologi for et bedre samfunn og FNs bærekraftmål er førende for vår virksomhet.   Avdeling Termisk energi ved SINTEF Energi utvikler og gjennomfører prosjekter med utgangspunkt i utnyttelse, transport og lagring av varme - fra industriell overskuddsvarme til biomasse og gass. Dette gjør vi i samarbeid med ledende norske og internasjonale industriaktører med fokus på å realisere løsninger som bidrar til mer effektiv energibruk og reduserte klimagassutslipp.    Vi søker folk med nysgjerrighet, spisskompetanse og ambisjoner innen våre fagområder - og som ønsker å bidra i den grønne omstillingen.    Vi har en ledende rolle i flere internasjonale prosjekter og vi bidrar i utviklingen av teknologi og løsninger for framtidens bærekraftige industri. Noen sentrale fagområder er effektiv energibruk, integrerte energisystemer, energilagring, bioenergi, bruk av hydrogen og prosesser for avkarbonisering av industrien.  Vi leder blant annet HighEFF, som er verdens største forskningssenter innen energieffektivisering i industrielle prosesser (Forskningssenter for Miljøvennlig Energi (FME)) og vi deltar i tilsvarende senter på Bioenergi (Bio4Fuels) og CO2 fangst, transport og lagring (NCCS). Avdelingen er involvert i flere internasjonale EU prosjekter i samarbeid med internasjonale universitet og forskningsinstitutt i tillegg til internasjonal industri.    Sentralt i vår strategi er samspillet mellom laboratorieforsøk og matematiske modeller innen termiske prosesser. Det betyr at vi utvikler og bygger avansert utstyr i laboratoriet som benyttes til å fremskaffe data av høy kvalitet. Eksperimentelle data er nødvendig for å utvikle og forstå matematiske modeller, samt for validering av prosesser og komponenter.   I SINTEF har du mulighet til å utvikle dine ferdigheter og realisere dine ambisjoner på mange områder, både i retning av faglig ekspertise, prosjektledelse og linjeledelse. Lagarbeid er viktig siden prosjektene vanligvis krever innsats fra flere spesialister. En stilling hos oss innebærer prosjektledelse, prosjektutvikling og formidling samt nettverksbygging i industri og akademia, i tillegg til faglig utvikling. Erfaring fra prosjektarbeid og -utvikling i næringslivet kan påvirke den stillingen du eventuelt trer inn i.    Vi er samlokalisert med NTNU, og har tett samarbeid med NTNU i mange av prosjektene våre og i laboratoriene.    Vi søker personer med relevant bakgrunn på mastergrads- eller ph.d.-nivå, og som har evner og lyst til å jobbe innen våre fagområder. Industrierfaring vil være en styrke.    Vi tilbyr:     Gode utviklingsmuligheter     Godt arbeidsmiljø     Lønn etter avtale     Gunstige pensjons- og forsikringsordninger     Fleksibel arbeidstid

title: Experienced Engineer with PDMS/ E3D - Piping layout and design, Stress analysis and knowledge with NORSOK, ASME & API?
description: Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry.Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”Our Customer is a leading drilling and offshore wind company. For the organization at Kokstad we are searching for an experienced Piping Engineer. Start up as soon as possible. Your next job? Job description:Estimation, concept, studies, engineering & design, project executionOil & Gas, wind & green technologyOffshore/onshore surveys, FAT, workshop and installation follow up offshore/onshore and at yard stays Coordination and mechanical completionQualifications:Technical, Bachelor or Master degree within engineering with minimum 5 years' experienceExperience:2D draft/3D modellingExperience with PDMS/ E3D and Autodesk Navisworks Experience with AutoCAD or MicroStationPiping layout and designExperience with NORSOK, ASME, API, etc.Stress analysisPractical knowledge concerning fabrication of pipe/supportsHands on - Experience from both practical and design workPersonal skills:Committed, motivated and safety conscientiousCreative and constructiveDetermined and result orientedGood verbal and written communication skills, Norwegian and English as a minimum Team player and developerAbility to work independently and in teamsExtensive computer skillsCome join Akkodis! We have a lot of opportunities! We can promise you assignment at our customer's that are leading companies in front of the energy industry. Please apply as soon as possible - for further information please contact Milena Miccoli tel. 99 51 72 63 / milena.miccoli@akkodisgroup.com

title: Har du gyldig offshore sertifikat og kan reise på offshore befaring som mekanisk ingeniør?
description: Vår kunde er en stor betydelig leverandør av prosjekter innen olje og gass, elektrifisering og havvind. På grunn av pågående kontrakter og nye tildelinger har deres behov for nye ressurser økt betydelig. title: Opportunity to work in Snøhvit detail engineering phase
description: For client we are looking for a Senior HVAC System Engineer to work in Snøhvit detail engineering phase.The project is modification of an existing onshore LNG plant:-Maintaining the plateau production by installing a new Feed Gas Compressor Module.-Reduce emission by introducing power from shore and installing one Electrode Steam Boiler module to the existing Snøhvit LNG plant.-Installation of an emergency power generator station, which for HVAC means ventilation, cooling, heat recuperation and sanitary systems for 3 new buildings and some work in 4 existing buildings.You will have the opportunity to work with:-Functional requirements, control philosophy, operation philosophy-Ventilation systems-Chilled water and water based heat recovery system-Additional new toilet buildings-Pressure drop calculations in Magicad for Revit-Align the design with TEK17 where required-Coordination with HVAC procurement package responsible engineers and HVAC area engineers-Coordination with other disciplines in the projectsRequired Education:Master or Bachelor degreeRequired Work Experience:-Min. 5 years working experience in HVAC System design, in engineering-Working experience from detail engineering phase is preferredRequired Qualifications:-Ability to work independently and thoroughly as well as ability to work in team.-Multidiscipline understanding-Good communication skills-Have a high loyalty to deadline and quality requirements.-Be proactive, seeking advice and share own experiences with others.-Communicate well in English – both oral and in writingPlanned start date: 01.10.23Planned end date: 31.12.25Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry.Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”

title: Planner
description: Hos Aibel har du muligheten til å utvikle karrieren din gjennom et spekter av prosjekter innen fornybar og olje og gass. Vi kaller oss Engineering Pioneers. Uansett hvilken jobb vi har, så angriper vi den med kreativitet, nysgjerrighet og et driv etter å finne nye og bedre løsninger. Vi ser etter en planlegger som kan styrke vår planavdeling i Hammerfest. Hos oss vil du vil du få spennende utfordringer og oppgaver på anlegg i pågående vedlikeholdskontrakter.Om stillingenSom planlegger i Aibel vil du delta i en faggruppe både lokalt og nasjonalt, samt være en del av vårt multidisipline fagmiljø. Her vil du kunne få en god faglig utvikling og helhetsforståelse for olje- og gassindustrien ved å delta i våre ulike vedlikeholds- og modifikasjonsprosjekter. Ansvaret og de erfaringer du får hos oss i Hammerfest gir deg et solid utgangspunkt for å bygge din karriere i Nord-Norge.Ansvarsområder og arbeidsoppgaver inkluderer:Utarbeidelse av installasjonsaktiviteterInnhenting av 3. parts tjenester/aktiviteter Innhenting av data fra andre disipliner/faser Oppfølging av datoendringer og fremdrift Delta i avklaringer mot kundeVedlikehold av AO’er i SAPKvalifikasjonerBachelorgrad innen teknisk fagretningLang erfaring som installasjonsplanlegger kan oppveie for manglende formell utdanning2-3 års erfaring innen installasjon og installasjonsplanlegging innen olje & gass sektoren (planlegging i SAP) er ønskeligNyutdannede oppfordres også til å søkePersonlige egenskaperGod kompetanse på planleggingsprosessenGode muntlige og skriftlige kommunikasjonsevner, norsk og engelskProfesjonell, grundig og nøyaktigHøy arbeidskapasitetGode samarbeidsevner og evne til å jobbe i team og selvstendigFleksibel og vant til å jobbe i et arbeidsmiljø med høyt tempoErfaring fra Vedlikehold og Modifikasjoner er en fordelBli vår kollegaHos Aibel har du mange karrieremuligheter. Vi legger til rette for at du kan arbeide på tvers av fagområder, bygge kompetanse og utvikle ditt eget potensiale. Dette bidrar til pulserende og engasjerende arbeidsmiljø. Vi tilbyr også fleksibel arbeidstid, og velferdsklubbene våre har et bredt spekter av aktiviteter og treningsmuligheter for alle våre ansatte.Vår strategi er å styrke selskapets sterke posisjon innen ulike energisegmenter som havvind, olje og gass og hydrogen. Samtidig forfølger vi alltid nye muligheter. Aibel ser samfunnsansvar som en grunnleggende forutsetning, og derfor er bærekraftig utvikling en naturlig del av våre retningslinjer, arbeidsprosedyrer og beslutningsprosesser.Vi verdsetter mangfold og jobber målrettet for å sikre inkludering for alle ansatte. Kan du identifisere deg med vårt verdigrunnlag, og blir du inspirert av vår visjon?Da vil vi gjerne høre fra deg! Søknadsfrist og kontaktinformasjon:Har du spørsmål om stillingen er du velkommen til å kontakteSection Manager Commercial Magne Eirik Nielsen, tlf. 97 74 05 68, e-post: mage.eirik.nielsen@aibel.comArbeidssted: HammerfestSøknadsfrist: 30.09.2023Søknader vurderes fortløpende

title: Experience with risk management & knowledge to NORSOK, Petroleum Safety Authority Norway, Norwegian Maritime Authority ?
description: Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry.Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together” Our Customer is a leading drilling and offshore wind company. For the organization at Kokstad we are searching for å QHSE / Tecnical Safety Engineer. Start up as soon as possible - long term assignment. Your next job?JOB DESCRIPTIONS / WORK TASKS:Risk assessments such as HAZID, HAZOP, Change & Constructability analysis, Design Review, Change analysis e.g.Risk identification and follow-up for Engineering projectsStudy and project execution within QHSE and/or Technical SafetyISO 14001 compliance and AuditsISO 9001 compliance and AuditsQHSE and Technical Safety input to tendersParticipate as QHSE Manager on yard stay on various locationsInvestigations of incidents and this may include offshore travelEstablish and update relevant procedures / documents for QHSE disciplineEXPERIENCE / KNOWLEDGE:Good IT and system skillsVarious methods of risk assessments (significant part of the job)Preferably experience from Mobile Offshore Units, such as inspections, yard stay, e.g.Knowledge to relevant standards such as NORSOK S-001, NORSOK S-002, Petroleum Safety Authority Norway, Norwegian Maritime Authority e.g.ISO 9001 and 14001 knowledge and understandingTechnical SafetySafety consciousWorking environmentExternal environmentDrilling related experience is an advantage Come join Akkodis! We have a lot of opportunities! We can promise you assignment at our customer's that are leading companies in front of the energy industry. Please apply as soon as possible - for further information please contact Milena Miccoli tel. 99 51 72 63 / milena.miccoli@akkodisgroup.com

title: Engineers MC/Commissioning
description: Hos Aibel har du muligheten til å utvikle karrieren din gjennom et spekter av prosjekter innen fornybar og olje og gass. Vi kaller oss Engineering Pioneers. Uansett hvilken jobb vi har, så angriper vi den med kreativitet, nysgjerrighet og et driv etter å finne nye og bedre løsninger. Vi er på jakt etter dedikerte teknikere, ingeniører eller senior ingeniører som ønsker å være med på utvikle en av de mest spennende ingeniørbedriftene i Nord-Norge.  Vi vil styrke vår MC/COM avdelingen i Harstad hvor du får jobbe innenfor mechanical completion (MC), commissioning (COM) og som feltingeniør. Om stillingenSom MC/COM ingeniør vil du følge prosjekter fra studie, realisering, ferdigstillelse og overlevering til kunde. Oppfølging og samhandling med utførende feltingeniører med fokus på kvalitetssikring av MC aktiviteter. Ved behov stiller du som MC ingeniør på MC inspeksjon og Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT) hos leverandør. Du kan også jobbe som feltingeniør i korte eller lengre perioder.Ansvarsområder og arbeidsoppgaver inkluderer:Definere system matrise, boundaries, commissioning pakker og MC pakkerBidra med god dialog på tvers av fagområder og lokasjonerDelta aktivt i alle engineeringsfaser fra studie til gjennomføringInput til MC dokumentasjon i sjekklister, planer og prosedyrer etter prosjektets behovAnsvarlig for utarbeidelse av  commissioningprosedyrerKvalifikasjonerFagbrev innen elektro/instrument/automasjon fageneTeknisk fagskole er ønskeligLang relevant erfaring kan kompensere for manglende formell kompetanseGode IT-kunnskaper Flytende Norsk og Engelsk, skriftlig og muntligErfaring fra olje og gassindustrien, både land og offshore, er ønskeligPersonlige egenskaperDu er ansvarlig og har gode HMS holdningerDu er visjonær og ønsker å bidra til å finne nye løsninger og metoderVi ser på deg som fleksibel og løsningsorientertDu er åpen for nye ideer, du bruker din kompetanse og erfaring til å utvikle dine kolleger og vår organisasjonBli vår kollegaHos Aibel har du mange karrieremuligheter. Vi legger til rette for at du kan arbeide på tvers av fagområder, bygge kompetanse og utvikle ditt eget potensiale. Dette bidrar til pulserende og engasjerende arbeidsmiljø. Vi tilbyr også fleksibel arbeidstid, og velferdsklubbene våre har et bredt spekter av aktiviteter og treningsmuligheter for alle våre ansatte.Vår strategi er å styrke selskapets sterke posisjon innen ulike energisegmenter som havvind, olje og gass og hydrogen. Samtidig forfølger vi alltid nye muligheter. Aibel ser samfunnsansvar som en grunnleggende forutsetning, og derfor er bærekraftig utvikling en naturlig del av våre retningslinjer, arbeidsprosedyrer og beslutningsprosesser.Vi verdsetter mangfold og jobber målrettet for å sikre inkludering for alle ansatte. Kan du identifisere deg med vårt verdigrunnlag, og blir du inspirert av vår visjon?Da vil vi gjerne høre fra deg! Søknadsfrist og kontaktinformasjon:Har du spørsmål om stillingen er du velkommen til å kontakteAvdelingsleder Øyvind Solberg, epost: oyvind.solberg at aibel.comArbeidssted: HarstadSøknadsfrist: 30.09.2023 , søknader vurderes fortløpende

title: Research Scientist within sustainable technologies
description: The research group Thin Film and Membrane Technology develops sustainable technologies for developing the hydrogen value chain (production, separation, use, transport), solid state batteries, barrier materials, sensors and CO2 capture and utilisation. Our multidisciplinary and interdisciplinary group strives at providing innovative solutions to reduce environmental footprint and improved efficiency. This, we do by working on the whole value chain, starting from providing new materials solutions, advanced components and reactors, degradation models, etc., up to the demonstration of prototypes operated in industrial environment with our clients. Our project's portfolio includes national and European projects, encompassing both fundamental and applied research. We are equipped with multiple laboratories including two large clean rooms, and designed for materials synthesis, forming and sintering, as well as for advanced characterisation and testing of materials, components, and reactors/modules/stacks in a safe environment.  The role  We are seeking a highly motivated and dynamic researcher to join our team for:  Carrying out exciting research and development work Participating in national and European projectsDeveloping new projects and engaging with customers and funding organizationsManaging scientific research and projects of various sizesActively disseminating results with publication and presentations in national and international fora   The following qualifications are sought:  MSc or PhD in either chemical engineering, electrochemistry, materials science, chemistry, solid state physics or related disciplinesExperience with technologies such as fuel cells, electrolysers, batteries, mixed ion conducting membranes, polymeric membranes, Pd membranes, CCUS, chemical looping, barrier materials for gas distribution, etc. Expertise in some of the following areas: atomistic modelling, sol-gel and template assisted synthesis routes, ceramic processing and 3D printing, thin film deposition, electrochemical characterization and modelling, reactor modelling, reactor/stack testing, etc.  Strong ability to work in laboratories should be documentedExperience with calibration and maintenance of instrumentsExperience with interfacing for acquisition of laboratory equipmentStrong ability to work in teams Ability to communicate well in Norwegian and/or English, both orally and writtenWe offer:  A multicultural and social working environment with colleagues who want to make a difference.Great opportunities for scientific and personal development in an organization that values responsibility and initiative.A vibrant and inspiring professional organization, which is leading in several areas in Europe.Flexible working hours, salary based on qualifications, good pension and welfare schemes.   The successful candidate will be a member of SINTEF Industry, the Department of Sustainable Energy Technology with workplace located in Oslo, Norway.

title: Løft karrieren din som Planlegger!
description: Aker Solutions er på jakt etter planleggere med EPCI-erfaring for å hjelpe oss med å lykkes i vårt mål om å løse globale energiutfordringer for fremtidige generasjoner.Likte du å legge puslespill som liten? Har du planlagt neste års sommerferie allerede? Er du den som tør å stille de spørsmålene ingen andre stiller?Vi trenger både deg med erfaring fra prosjektgjennomføring i EPCI, deg som har jobbet som planlegger tidligere men kanskje er litt rusten på systemene, og deg som ønsker å avansere til en Planning Manager og få ansvar for banebrytende prosjekter. Viktigst av alt for å lykkes i denne rollen er at du er en relasjonsbygger, nysgjerrig av natur, og tør å spørre når du er usikker på noe.Arbeidssted er fleksibelt – vi har kontorer over hele landet, fra Kristiansand i sør til Sandnessjøen i nord. Selv om stillingen er knyttet opp mot et kontor er det mulighet for å bli ansatt på ulike lokasjoner.BANEBRYTENDE PROSJEKTEROlje- og gassutvinning på norsk kontinentalsokkel står for 27 prosent av landets totale CO2-utslipp.Aker Solutions jobber for øyeblikket med flere banebrytende prosjekter relatert til fornybar energi og energiomstilling, inkludert områder som flytende og faste offshore-vindprosjekter, elektrifisering, karbonfangst og -lagring, og hydrogen. Flere av prosjektene vi er involvert i er verdens første i sitt slag, for eksempel Hywind Tampen som blir verdens største flytende offshore-vindpark og den første som gir strøm til offshore olje- og gassplattformer. Vi er også hovedentreprenør for EPCI’en til Draugen Power from Shore, som forventes å redusere utslippene fra Draugen med opptil 200 000 tonn CO2 per år.Sentralt i alle våre prosjekter sitter Planleggeren, og for å lykkes med våre ambisiøse mål har vi et langsiktig mål om å styrke vår planleggingsmuskel, og vi ønsker oss flere dedikerte og engasjerte medarbeidere til å bli med og gjøre en forskjell.Oppfyller du ikke alle kravene og er i tvil om du skal søke?Vi vurderer alle søknader og vil tilby den opplæringen som kreves. Så langt har 78 ansatte vært gjennom vårt modulbaserte kompetansehevingsprogram Planning Academy.Nå har vi tatt det et steg videre, og inngått samarbeid med Høyskolen på Vestlandet og lanserer kurset Prosjektplanlegging for planleggere denne høsten som også gir studiepoeng. Likevel er det på jobben vi lærer mest, og den gode kulturen for å dele kunnskap er nok det vi er mest stolte av.Ved å bli med i vårt team vil du være en katalysator for positiv forandring og være en del av transformative prosjekter som har betydelig innvirkning på norsk og internasjonal sokkel. Hos oss er karrieremulighetene og mulighetene for videreutvikling mange. Vi håper å høre fra deg!Flere grunner til å søke:Du vil få sjansen til å være en del av vår nye, store satsing på Industriledende teknologiStore muligheter for faglig utvikling gjennom Planning AcademyKonkurransedyktig lønn og ytelser med gode pensjons- og forsikringsordninger, velferdsklubb med masse aktiviteter og hytter til leie, samt private helsetjenester levert av Aker CareMulighet for å jobbe eksternt/hjemmefra 1-3 dager per ukeUnikt arbeidsmiljø og en bransjeledende prosjektgjennomføringsmodell

title: Experienced within system design, interface and follow up automation network on the platform or landfall projects?
description: Akkodis is one of the largest companies globally within Smart Industry.Akkodis Norway is one of Norway's largest suppliers of technical consulting services and a delivers roles at all levels within Engineering, IT and project administration.We offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”Our customer is a leading service company within oil/gas and offshore wind. For their site in Haugesund we are in search of a Sr. Automation Engineer. Long term assignment. Your next job?Planned start date: 04.09.23Planned end date: 31.12.25Job Responsibilities;SAS system design and follow upSystem design, interface and follow up automation network on the platform or landfall projectsInterface solution towards SAS system and electrical control systemParticipate in fire and gas safety reviewsGive input to and follow up system design for equipment packagesReview vendor technical documentationDesign and improve solutions according to client’s requirementsSAS hardware designInterface to other disciplinesMultidiscipline Interface and collaboration with site.Prepare and complete engineering documents and data registersRequired EducationMaster or bachelor degree within automation or equivalentRequired Work Experience:• Minimum 6 years relevant experience• Experience from large modification projects on the Norwegian Continental Shelf• Experience and extensive knowledge of automation design according to relevant standards such as NORSOK, ATEX, PTIL and IEC.• Detailed knowledge of Statoil technical requirementsRequired Qualifications;• Able to work independently as well as a part of a team• Multidiscipline understanding• Good communicating skills• A cooperative working attitude• Be systematic, accurate and efficient• Creative and solution-oriented• Have a high loyalty to deadlines and quality requirements• Be proactive, seeking advice and share own experience with others• Communicate well in Norwegian, both orally and in writing• Solid understanding of computer programming and software development• Ability to troubleshoot equipment problems and perform complex system tests• Creative thinking skills Required sertificates;- FSE/EX course Please apply as soon as possible! Any questions please contact Milena Miccoli tel. 99 51 72 63 / milena.miccoli@akkodisgroup.com

title: Stipendiat i hydrogenrensing
description:
Stipendiat i hydrogenrensing
                Om stillingenUniversitetet i Stavanger har ledig stilling som stipendiat i hydrogenrensing ved Det teknisk- naturvitenskapelige fakultet, Institutt for kjemi, biovitenskap og miljøteknologi. Stillingen er ledig fra november 2023.Dette er en utdanningsstilling som i hovedsak skal gi lovende forskere anledning til faglig utvikling gjennom en forskerutdanning. Den som ansettes vil bli tatt opp på doktorgradsprogrammet i teknologi og naturvitenskap. Programmet omfatter relevante kurs i et omfang som tilsvarer omkring et halvt års studium, en avhandling basert på selvstendig forskning, deltakelse i nasjonale og internasjonale forskermiljø, relevant forskningsformidling, prøveforelesning og disputas. Les mer om forskerutdanningen ved UiS på våre nettsider. (https://www.uis.no/nb/forskning/phd-utdanning-ved-uis)Stipendiaten ansettes for en periode på tre år med ren forskerutdanning.ForskningstemaStipendiaten vil være tilknyttet Hyvalue - Forskningssenter for miljøvennlig energi. Senteret skal utvikle kunnskap, metodikk og innovative løsninger for hydrogenenergibærere.Hydrogen vil ha en nøkkelrolle i overgangen til en lavkarbonøkonomi. Imidlertid utgjør dagens produksjon og rensing av hydrogen (både fornybar og ikke-fornybar) betydelige teknologiske og miljømessige utfordringer som må adresseres for å nå dets fulle potensial.Ph.D.-prosjektet vil sette søkelys på å utvikle og teste nye materialteknologier for hydrogenproduksjon og -rensing som er effektive, kostnadseffektive og miljøvennlige. Prosjektet vil bruke banebrytende forskning innen områder som materialvitenskap og gassbehandling (PSA, TSA og membran) for å utvikle nye løsninger som adresserer de viktigste utfordringene innen hydrogenrensing.Den aktuelle kandidaten vil jobbe i gruppen for funksjonelt materiale og prosesskjemi (https://www.uis.no/en/research/functional-materials-and-process-chemistry-group) og få verdifull erfaring innen både grunnforskning og anvendt næringslivsteknologi. Hyvalue-senteret samarbeider med flere aktører innenfor næringslivet, så det er en god mulighet for nettverksbygging og tett samarbeid om industrielle utfordringer for den aktuelle kandidaten. Den som ansettes vil ha Professor Adelio Mendes som medveileder og vil utføre noe av oppgavearbeidet ved Universitetet i Porto. Dette er en spennende mulighet til å gjøre en reell innvirkning innen ren energi og bidra til utviklingen av en mer bærekraftig fremtid. Vi oppfordrer alle kvalifiserte kandidater med lidenskap for ren energi og sterk faglig bakgrunn innen relevante felt til å søke.KvalifikasjonerDu må ha en sterk faglig bakgrunn med femårig mastergrad (3+2) innenfor kjemi, materialteknologi, kjemi- eller prosessteknikk, eller tilsvarende utdanning som gir grunnlag for å gjennomføre en forskerutdanning, fortrinnsvis av nyere dato.Det vil være en fordel å ha erfaring med:testing av materialer for hydrogenrensinggasseparasjonsenheter som adsorpsjon (PSA og TSA) og membranerprosesssimuleringsprogram (Aspen etc)materialkarakterisering (ved bruk av røntgendiffraksjon, termogravimetrisk analyse, N2-sorpsjon, skanning elektron mikroskopi, osv.), og reprodusere rapportert materialsynteseDersom karakteren din på masteroppgaven og veid gjennomsnittskarakter på masterstudiet begge hver for seg tilsvarer B eller bedre, er du den vi søker etter. Avslutter du utdanningen din høsten 2023, er du også velkommen til å søke. Dersom du har utdannelse fra en institusjon med annen karakterskala enn A-F ber vi deg om å legge ved en bekreftet konverteringsskala som viser hvordan karakterene kan sammenliknes med den norske A-F skalaen. Du kan bruke disse konverteringsskalaene til å beregne poengene dine for opptak. (https://www.uis.no/sites/default/files/2021-04/Conversion%20of%20results_0.pdf)Videre legges det vekt på at du:er motivert, har potensial for forskning innenfor fagfeltethar faglige og personlige forutsetninger for å gjennomføre doktorgradsutdanningen innen ansettelsesperiodenkan arbeide selvstendig og i et fellesskap, være nytenkende og kreativer strukturert og har stor arbeidskapasitethar gode ferdigheter i engelsk, både skriftlig og muntlig.Krav til kompetanse i engelskGode ferdigheter i engelsk er påkrevd for deltakelse i doktorgradsprogrammet. Internasjonale søkere må dokumentere at en har gjennomført en av følgende tester med angitte resultater eller bedre:TOEFL - Test of English as a Foreign Language, Internet-Based Test (IBT). Minimum resultat: 90IELTS - International English Language Testing Service. Minimum resultat: 6.5Certificate in Advanced English (CAE) eller Certificate of Proficiency in English (CPE) fra Universitetet i CambridgePTE Academic - Pearson Test of English Academic. Minimum resultat: 62Følgende søkere er fritatt fra ovennevnte krav:søkere med ett års fullført universitetsstudier i Australia, Canada, Irland, New Zealand, Storbritannia, USAsøkere med International Baccalaureate (IB) diplomsøkere med fullført bachelor- og/eller mastergrad med engelsk som undervisningsspråk i et EU-/EØS-landsøkere som er fritatt basert på NOKUT sin GSU liste (http://hkdir.no/en/foreign-education/lists-and-databases/higher-education-entrance-qualification-gsu)Vi tilbyrforskerutdanning i en stor organisasjon med et viktig samfunnsoppdraget ambisiøst arbeidsfellesskap og et inkluderende arbeidsmiljølønn etter Statens lønnsregulativ l.pl 17.515, kode 1017, kr 532.200 bto pr år med lønnsutvikling etter ansiennitet i stillingen. I særskilte tilfeller kan høyere avlønning vurderes. Fra lønnen trekkes lovfestet innskudd til Statens pensjonskasse.medlemskap i Statens pensjonskasse (http://www.spk.no) sikrer gode pensjons- og forsikringsordningermer om ansattgoder og fordeler (https://www.uis.no/nb/uis-som-arbeidsplass) på uis.noMangfoldUniversitetets verdier er å være uavhengig, involverende og skapende. Vi vurderer mangfold som en ressurs i vårt arbeids- og læringsmiljø, og er opptatt av å vise respekt for hverandres ulikheter og bakgrunn. Universell utforming skal prege våre fysiske og digitale læringsmiljø, og arbeidsplassen vil bli lagt til rette for ansatte med nedsatt funksjonsevne. Dersom du vurderer stillingen som interessant oppfordrer vi deg til å søke, uavhengig av kjønn, funksjonsevne, kulturell bakgrunn eller om du en periode har vært utenfor arbeidslivet.Universitetet vil rekruttere flere kvinner til stillinger som stipendiat innenfor fagområdet. Dersom flere søkere anses å ha likeverdige kvalifikasjoner, vil en kvinne bli prioritert foran en mann.KontaktinformasjonNærmere opplysninger om stillingen og prosjektbeskrivelse fås ved henvendelse til førsteamanuensis Sachin Chavan, tlf: 51 83 15 41, e-post: sachin.m.chavan@uis.no.Opplysninger om ansettelsesprosessen fås ved henvendelse til HR-rådgiver Rosa Andrade, tlf: 51 83 11 91, e-post: rekruttering@uis.no.SøknadenSøk stillingen elektronisk via ""Søk stillingen"" på denne siden. Her registreres minimum søknadsbrev, relevant utdanning og arbeidserfaring samt språkferdigheter. I søknadsbrevet må du få frem dine forskningsinteresser og motivasjon for stillingen.Følgende skal lastes opp som vedlegg til søknaden:CV med fullstendig oversikt over utdanning og erfaringvitnemål og attester samt dokumentasjon på annen aktivitet som vurderes relevant Diploma Supplement eller lignende og konverteringsskala dersom dette er påkrevddokumentasjon på kompetanse i engelsk språk dersom dette er påkrevdpublikasjoner eller annet relevant forskningsarbeidSøknaden vil bli vurdert ut fra informasjonen som foreligger i Jobbnorge ved søknadsfristen. Sørg derfor for at søknaden tydelig viser hvordan dine ferdigheter og erfaringer oppfyller kriteriene som er beskrevet over og at du har lagt ved nødvendig dokumentasjon.Dokumentasjonen må foreligge på et skandinavisk språk eller engelsk. Hvis vedleggene overskrider 30 MB til sammen må disse komprimeres før opplasting.Vi gjør oppmerksom på at opplysninger om søker kan bli offentliggjort selv om søker har anmodet om ikke å bli oppført på offentlig søkerliste, jf offentlighetsloven § 25. (https://lovdata.no/lov/2006-05-19-16/§25) Dersom din anmodning ikke blir tatt til følge vil du bli varslet om dette.UiS vurderer bare søknader og vedlegg registrert i Jobbnorge.Generell informasjonAnsettelsen blir gjennomført etter prinsippene i statsansatteloven (https://lovdata.no/dokument/NL/lov/2017-06-16-67), og lovverk som regulerer eksport av kunnskap, teknologi og tjenester. Dersom søknaden din vurderes å være i strid med kriteriene i sistnevnte lovverk vil du få denne avslått uten videre vurdering.Ansettelse som stipendiat er regulert i Forskrift om ansettelsesvilkår for stillinger som postdoktor, stipendiat, vitenskapelig assistent samt spesialistkandidat (https://lovdata.no/dokument/SF/forskrift/2006-01-31-102?q=forskrift om ansettelsesvilkår).Din kompetanse for stillingen, ut fra dokumentasjon registrert i Jobbnorge, vil bli vurdert av en intern komite. På bakgrunn av komiteens uttalelse vil aktuelle søkere bli invitert til intervju. Det vil også bli innhentet referanser for aktuelle kandidater. Mer om ansettelsesprosessen på våre nettsider. (http://www.uis.no/nb/jobb-ved-uis-sokeprosessen) Studiet gjennomføres i hovedsak ved Universitetet i Stavanger, bortsett fra et avtalt utenlandsopphold i et anerkjent relevant forskningsmiljø.Det er en forutsetning at du bosetter deg slik at du kan være tilstede ved, og tilgjengelig for, fagmiljøet på arbeidsplassen i ordinær arbeidstid.Stillingen er kunngjort på både norsk og engelsk. Ved meningsforskjell mellom tekstene skal den engelske teksten legges til grunn.

title: IT Solution Architect
description:
Rosenberg Worley AS delivers complete solutions within EPCIC projects (engineering, procurement, construction, installation, and commissioning). We are an important player in the Norwegian offshore energy industry, and we are embracing new markets for a sustainable future including floating offshore wind, electrification, hydrogen, and ocean farming.We have exciting projects underway and are looking for individuals that want to take part in the digital revolution and the global energy transition.Who are we looking for?Rosenberg Worley AS has a complex and mixed IT environment with fabrication equipment, offshore connectivity and the traditional IT environment for office and engineering.We are looking for an IT Solution Architect to strengthen our digitalization team.The solution architect’s responsibilities are to map, define and standardize technology, data, and business processes. The role must understand the business strategy and translate this into an architectural approach (macro view). The role must also be able to work with individual projects and provide concrete guidance to these projects that focuses on the individual delivery of the individual project to ensure that the delivery fits the IT landscape supporting the business strategyResponsibilities
                Representing IT Services with stakeholders in the business, with an undertaking to escalate issues to the relevant IT Services management teamEngage in product selection (including dependent products), and determine configuration of the selected technologyDetermine product impact: Sizing and costing; Capacity planning; Installation/governance/migration impacts.Interface with local and global IT Ops team for Infrastruture related requirements/guidelines wrt Planning and InstallationCreate and Maintain Rosenberg / Worley Reference Enterprise Architecture model within the IT teamContribute to infrastructure landscape to ensure simple application connectivity and efficient data usage.Identify and build catalogues of core business assets describing IT service portfolio including infrastructure business application and data.Define the classification of platform services and logical technology components (including standards). Rationalize data requirements and align with any existing enterprise data catalogues and models. Update and develop matrices across the architecture by relating data to business service, business function, access rights, and applicationQualifications
                5+ years’ experience with relevant architecture certifications, ideally in the delivery of global IT servicesMaster’s / bachelor’s degree qualified in IT or related fields5+ years’ experience with development and publishing of policies, standards, processes and procedures for global IT architectures5+ years’ experience with TOGAF, or equivalent practical experience with Enterprise / Solution ArchitectureDeep technical capabilities in two or more Rosenberg and Worley technology vendors: Microsoft, Cisco, EMC, Citrix, Intergraph and major ERP systems ( preferably IFS)Skills
                This role will be a senior IT Services role and will require a mature approach to managing both peers and upline management. It is expected that interpersonal skillsneed to be of a high standard.Excellent written, oral and presentation communication skill.Ability to work and/or manage globally dispersed virtual teams across a number of IT Services disciplines.Excellent negotiation and facilitation skills.We believe that providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.

title: Do you have Technical school higher qualification or Bachelor s degree in an engineering discipline
description: Core ResponsibilitiesThe prime purpose of the Senior Reliability Engineer position is to identify the pro-active maintenance requirements for assets to increase unit productivity, maximise reliability performance in a sustainable way and to capture all opportunities to improve processes while reducing total cost. This will be achieved through actions to review and update the site criticality assessment, implement/review the Equipment Reliability Strategy (ERS) programme to ensure appropriate deployment, evaluate proactive work results, follow up with appropriate action to restore asset integrity and carry out investigations into failures to eliminate their rootcauses. All opportunities to improve asset integrity will be captured while complying with HSE requirements and in alignment with Reliability Excellence practices/processes.DutiesSupport with reliability knowledge the execution of the asset criticalityDetermine the function, capability, functional failure modes, probability of failure, impact severity and acceptable risk for assets to define the right maintenance requirements to eliminate functional failures and their effects.Establish a systematic preventive maintenance (PM) review process with support from the Planner to ensure the effectiveness of the existing PM program.Review and contribute to Equipment Reliability Strategies.Coordinate PM efforts on site to measure and secure an upward trend of the Asset Health.Ensure appropriate follow up recommendations and actions from the inspection programme of assets.Identify and implement opportunities for improvement of Asset Health to optimise unit uptime.Support the work preparation process to ensure job plans are prepared that explains the correct proactive tasks for effective work execution.Support maintenance tasks aligned with the reliability improvement: improvement tasks,Inventory Management and Precision Maintenance skills improvement using reliability knowledge.Participate in and take relevant agreed actions for OPEX team meetings to ensure equipment capabilities and help to develop a culture focussed on solutions.Keep appropriate records to track HSE ResponsibilitiesResponsible for maintaining a high degree of awareness;Lead by doing; setting an example for others;Observe and report any unsafe activities, conditions or situations;If you observe anything unsafe use the ‘Stop Work’ Policy. QualificationsTechnical school higher qualification or Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline (preferably mechanical or electrical) or equivalent knowledge.Good knowledge of Maintenance process and activities.Advanced computer skills.Extensive knowledge of Maintenance Management SystemMinimum 3 years maintenance experience.Working knowledge of technical English (verbal and written).Understanding operating context of site assets / process systemsHave working and practical knowledge of multiple on-condition asset monitoring technologies to be confident in follow up recommendations.Ability to organize, coordinate and accomplish multiple tasks.Demonstrated ability to build and maintain effective working relationships internally and externally.Strong communication and organizational skills.Demonstrated effective systematic problem-solving skills.If you recognize these job functions and want to join the team, we look forward to hear from you. For questions regarding the position, you can contact Recruitment Consultant Ann-Christin Suphammer on T: +47 901 67 646  /  M: ann-christin.suphammer@akkodisgroup.comWe offer job opportunities in Norway and abroad, competitive terms and a professional marketing apparatus with good follow-up.Our projects are within Clean Technology with focus on battery, offshore wind and hydrogen. In addition we deliver to industries such as Oil & Gas, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Banking & Financial Services, Aerospace & Defence, Automotive & Transportation, Manufacturing & Logistics, Information & Communication Technology.“Engineering a Smarter Future Together”

title: Join DNV and continue your career as a Pipeline Engineer in one of the leading companies in the market!
description: Local Unit & Position DescriptionAre you interested in working in one of the world's leading competence centers for offshore pipelines, a section with a proud history, strong foundation, and a big impact on the future of energy transport? This might be your chance!The pipeline operations team works with energy companies, suppliers, authorities, and other industry players as an independent service provider. We are recognized as the leading advisor providing operational-phase assurance for pipelines and other assets, both onshore and offshore, throughout their lifecycle, from concept, through operations and re-qualification, to decommissioning.We deliver a broad suite of services within condition assessments and maintenance planning, technology development and qualification, e.g. pipelines for hydrogen and CO2 transport, technical assistance and operational support, and fitness for service assessments, e.g. gas transport and storage.The Pipeline Operations team in Høvik (Oslo) is part of the Pipeline Operations section with teams located in Norway, Germany, and the Netherlands.Tasks and responsibilities:Management of multi-disciplinary projectsStructural analysis and integrity assessmentQualification of new technologyRisk assessment servicesVerification and certification servicesParticipation in R&D projectsPosition QualificationsThe successful candidate should have:several years of relevant work experienceB.Sc., M.Sc., Ph.D. degree within:Subsea/Offshore engineeringMechanical engineeringStructural engineeringMaterials TechnologyMarine technologyRisk ManagementSubsea survey technologyAdvanced English skills both written and verbal. Additional Scandinavian language skills will be an advantage.  The candidate should preferably possess one or more of the following qualifications:Experience in project work and project engineeringExperience in pipeline engineering/designExperience with structural analysis, FEM, etc.Knowledge of risk and reliability assessmentsExperience in integrity managementExperience with programming (python, C/C++, etc.)We expect that you are:A team player, with a positive attitude and a good sense of humorAble to combine theoretical knowledge and practical skillsEager to learn and develop yourselfMotivated and ambitiousHaving good communication skills with colleagues and our clientsHaving high professional integrityReasons to join usAttractive rewards. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including 6 weeks annual vacation, subsidised canteen, competitive pension, insurance, and parental leave agreement, in addition to a global profit share scheme. Work/life balance. We offer flexible working hours and workplaces, with a focus on work/life balance for our employees.Supportive and caring culture. Our international culture embodies diverse colleagues who value teamwork and inclusion across business areas and borders. We offer opportunities for our employees to connect through social and professional networks. Our largest community CONNECT throws after-works and informal meetings all year long for you to join.Career and development. DNV offers extensive possibilities to grow and develop your competencies and career ambitions. We have a strong company culture with an emphasis on a growth mindset, knowledge sharing, and professional and personal development.By joining DNV you become part of a world-leading company whose purpose is to safeguard life, property, and the environment. Our values “we care, we share, we dare” characterize how we work and behave towards each other and our customers.Our Høvik office is in beautiful surroundings by the sea and can offer access to sailboats, kayaks, tennis courts, etc. We have more than 30 activity groups for you to join, as well as gym facilities and a kindergarten located on our premises. It is also worth noting that we offer free parking and shuttle buses to and from Skøyen, Lysaker, and Sandvika.

title: Do you want to lead significant design change for energy, maritime & defense industries?
description: Kongsberg Digital is a true industrial software company, and our vision is to change how people work for a better tomorrow. Our Industrial Worksurface ensures smarter, safer, and greener operations. We focus on heavy asset industries and support the green transition towards renewable industries like offshore wind, carbon capture, and hydrogen. Our head office is in Lysaker, Norway, and the other large offices are in the US, India, Bulgaria, and Denmark. Our team of global game changers includes subject matter experts in software development, visualization, data analytics, machine learning, simulation, and autonomous operations. Kongsberg Digital has experienced real commercial traction across the leading digital positions within maritime, energy, and renewables and is ambitious to grow from 1 BNOK to 3 BNOK in SaaS revenue over the next three years. Kongsberg Digital is now embarking on its next evolution of product offering, which will require the merging of our key product offerings, and has created a position within the organization – Global Head of UX. This vital position will be responsible for driving the next generation of User Experience and Product Design enhancements to KDI products. In addition, this role will also be focused on Product Analytics, User Engagement, and how user experience is improved through our transformation towards the industrial work surface.  To be successful in the role, the individual must have the following: An in-depth understanding of user-centered design methods, UX research methodologies, product discovery, and demonstrable success in developing and implementing a comprehensive UX strategy.  Though-leadership on User Experience, the ability to communicate, educate and grow a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. Ability to drive alignment across product experiences and toward our future Industrial Work Surface. With strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Understanding our company's business goals and aligning UX strategy with these objectives. Be able to visualize and communicate the long-term UX direction for the company. Experience leading, mentoring, and growing a global team of UX designers, researchers, and other UX-related roles. Experience driving and transforming user experiences in complex industrial software applications into engaging products. Nice to have: Experience across multiple sectors, including traditional sectors such as Energy, Utilities, Maritime, Logistics, or other complex industries. Experience facilitating design processes with clients. Most importantly, you possess grit, a game-changer mindset, and general superpowers to bring to the team here at Kongsberg Digital. Why settle for the ordinary when you can be part of the extraordinary? You will have the opportunity to work alongside industry experts, thought leaders, and innovative minds passionate about driving change. Where you will foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning. Where you will reshape the norms and build a future where everyone can thrive and excel. Where you can be part of our game-changing culture where we believe in empowering our employees to unleash their full potential and make a meaningful impact. Where you can be part of our commitment to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity & Inclusion: At Kongsberg Digital, we celebrate diversity and strive for inclusivity. We strongly believe that different perspectives and backgrounds drive innovation and contribute to our success. We actively promote a culture of inclusiveness that values and respects every individual, providing equal opportunities for all our employees. We will create a workplace where every game-changing employee can shine and seize equal opportunities. Application process: If you're ready to be a game changer in the pursuit of creating a better tomorrow, seize this opportunity! Please submit your resume and a compelling cover letter that showcases your relevant experience and articulates why joining us at Kongsberg Digital excites you.

title: Help shape the future of energy
description: At Aker Solutions, we design, manage, and build some of the most complex energy projects in the world. We are committed to the transition and are at the leading edge of decarbonizing oil and gas and developing zero carbon energy. Building on our renowned front-end engineering skills, we are creating a world-class consultancy which will utilize the experience and data gathered from our early mover advantage in such areas as low carbon oil and gas, electrification, CCS, hydrogen and floating offshore wind to provide robust decision-making analysis and advice to our customers.We are now looking for Senior Electrical Engineers who want to join our team in Trondheim.In the developing energy mix, commercial risks are as prominent as technical risks, and our consultancy will provide broad multi-faceted advice to our customers. This developing market, coupled with an unprecedented demand for our execution experience, means that we are looking to grow our consultancy team with technical, consulting and commercially minded individuals who can help us meet the challenge of a just and orderly energy transition.What will you be doing?Be a part of a highly qualified Engineering teamDevelop your engineering abilities by working with highly skilled engineersTake responsibility for discipline deliverablesTechnical responsible for instrument design and activities for the assigned projectGather results together with offshore and onshore operatorsCooperate closely with vendors finding the optimal solutionSporadic offshore travelsActively participate in relevant process/ safety reviewsContribute to the development of methodology, tools, and competencyImplement field life solutions for our customersWork together with large clients within the energy industryWe think you should have:You are an experienced and engaged instrument engineer with 10 years + of experience from the energy sectorExperience in design of concept, project studies, FEED verification and detail designExtensive knowledge with international codes and standards required i.e. ASME, NORSOKSolution oriented with collaboration skillsIn-depth knowledge of relevant Norwegian regulations and standardsA commercial mindset, good communication skills and the ability to work both independently and as part of a teamStrong work ethics and a proactive attitudeThe ability to see solutions together and meet customer expectations and requirementsThe competency to be accurate, flexible, and organizedSolid command of Norwegian and English, both written and spokenMore reasons to work with us:Professional development and excellent career opportunities with the chance to work on a wide variety of projectsA healthy work-life balance with flexible working conditions throughout the different phases of your journeyCompetitive pay and benefits with excellent pension and insurance schemes as well as private health services provided by Aker CareAccess to welfare club with free gym facilities, sport equipment hires and cabins to rent in the mountains and by the seaPossibility to work remotely/from home 1-3 days per weekThe opportunity to become a part of Young Solutioneers, an international employee network that brings together young talents for professional development, networking, and funInterested? Contact us.General questions regarding the recruitment process can be addressed to:Randi Lund, Senior Recruiter, NES Advantage Solutions, Randi.Lund@nesfircroft.com - Mobil: 918 99 980Questions regarding technical tasks can be addressed to:Svein Bardal, Department Manager, Aker Solutions, Mobil: 92823032NES Advantage Solutions is Aker Solutions’ global recruitment services provider responsible for permanent and temporary staffing services.Semac background checks are performed on all final candidates.Diversity and InclusionAker Solutions is empowered by its diverse workforce. We ensure a good working environment where equal opportunity, diversity and inclusion are considered vital to our success. We believe diversity creates value, attracts talent, and makes life more interesting. We therefore encourage and welcome applications from diverse backgrounds related to race, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, ethnicity, disability, age, and more.

title: Advisor - Sustainability Reporting and Management
description: Job DescriptionAs an Advisor in the Corporate Sustainability department, you’ll be contributing to our group-wide project on implementing new sustainability requirements into our reporting and management processes – using your sustainability skills to optimise our approach, increase awareness across the organisation, and design tomorrow’s reporting and management structure. You’ll be working with dedicated professionals across the company to help Statkraft deliver on its strategic ambitions. Please note that this is a 2-year temporary project position.You will:Contribute to ongoing corporate-wide efforts to adjust and align our approach to sustainability, including participating in our sustainability implementation project.Collaborate closely with key colleagues including those responsible for reporting and project management, supporting the development and rollout of corporate-wide approaches in line with good practices.Collaborate closely with the business and provide support to business area improvement initiatives related to the project and wider implementation efforts.Enable the company to assess and meet new sustainability requirements, and implement necessary activities for doing so.Further strengthen the company’s data gathering, reporting, and disclosure on sustainability, and develop good arenas for stakeholder engagement, internally & externally.QualificationsWe look for a candidate with 2-5 years of experience and a Master's degree. This includes knowledge of:Sustainability management – system development, processes, implementation, training, toolsReporting on sustainability using recognised and evolving frameworks incl. GRI, CDP, TCFD, CSRD, ESRS, UN Global CompactStrategic execution of sustainability targets and activities, incl. implement activities needed to meet new reporting requirements (e.g. EU Taxonomy, CSRD)Internal stakeholder engagement & facilitation of change management processesGood understanding of business-integrated sustainability and how this fits into overall business activities – including an understanding of both opportunities and risks related to the implementation of sustainability managementEnglish language fluency is required. Knowledge in Scandinavian languages would be an advantage. Experiences in these areas are also useful in your role:Analysis and structuring of complex information in a clear and understandable wayDesign thinking or similar dynamic working methodsPresenting and communicating effectively on sustainability topicsSelf-driven, comfortable with high work pressure, and a positive team playerAt Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to facilitate collaboration and bring people along in a fast-paced and ever-evolving business environment.Additional InformationWhat we offer A career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities, and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities, and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including Linkedin Learning and inspiring leadership programs like IMDThe chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists, and graduates from different countries and backgroundsThe opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave, and work-life balance principlesA focus on fun outside of work, supported by various activity groups such as soccer, yoga, sailing, climbing, boxing, cabin rentals, and much moreThe chance to enjoy a break and change of scenery in one of our amazing Statkraft cabins across the countryLocation: The position will be located at our HQ at Lilleaker, Oslo, Norway. Application deadline: September 6th, 2023Contact information: For questions about the role, please contact Sidsela Viken Nyebak (VP Head of Corporate Sustainability) via e-mail: sidsela.nyebak@statkraft.com or phone: +47 41145808. Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorization.

title: Commercial Analyst
description: Company DescriptionIf you’re a young professional or graduate with skills in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering or Business, you might be our new colleague. You can start a career that helps to solve the climate crisis, with Statkraft. As a commercial analyst you will leverage the power of digitalization to trade and steer flexible assets autonomously. Realise the potential of renewable energy. Make a positive impact on our planet.Why Statkraft?Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution. We believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.But there’s more work to be done. That’s why we need you to join us.Job DescriptionWorking in Nordic Market Access Platform TeamEnergy Management is responsible for energy management of all Statkraft’s own and 3rd party assets and consumers in Europe, delivering production planning and access to physical energy markets. We also deliver weather, hydrology, climate and market analysis across Statkraft.Digitalisation Energy Management (MED) unit supports the Energy Management (ME) business owners managing the business requirements for the IT systems on behalf of ME, with a professional interface towards IT. Furthermore, the unit supports the commercial energy management process with automation, analysis, structuring and pricing, and by providing an algorithmic trading infrastructure. The unit’s responsibility requires an in-depth understanding of the business processes and system landscape in ME.  The Nordic Market Access Platform team delivers management, development and improvements of systems supporting Nordic Market Access Platform (iMA) for industrial customers and 3rd party flex assets. A part of this is algorithmic trading and virtual power plant solutions that automatically balance, trade and steer asset flexibility in real-time and run proprietary trading activities. The exciting and innovative projects the team works on together with origination are revolutionizing Statkraft's energy management operations and helping to keep Statkraft as a leading market participant in the complex energy markets of the future.Key responsibilitiesAs Commercial Analyst in the Nordic Market Access Platform team you’ll:Support Origination in growing the Nordic customer portfolio and have a focus on customer satisfaction and value creation.  Take the end-to-end responsibility for design and implementation of new business products for customers in close cooperation with IT and front office teams. Assure the whole value change is covered from customer interaction to settlement and invoicing.Develop, improve and document robust optimisation and trading algorithms for a wide spectrum of customers flexible assets, such as furnaces, industrial processes, electric boilers, batteries, EVs, heating, etc.Collect and engineer the data necessary for modelling together with the IT development teamAnalyse and improve forecasting methodologies.Assure the solutions are in line with current and coming market structures and regulationsTake part in customer meetings and present analyses regarding the customers’ consumption and trading strategies.Make energy management easy for the customers!QualificationsWe are looking for graduates and young professionals with backgrounds in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering or Business with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes knowledge in:Excellent university degree, e.g. in mathematics, physics, computer science or business with strong quantitative focusStrong analytical skills, commercial mind set, quick learnerHigh diligence and quality in coding and model development preferably experience in PythonModelling and programming experienceExperience as a power trader is an assetProven ability to design and implement business processes and productsProactive and independent way of working, high reliability, strong communication skillsAt Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to lead, teach and help others learn. English language fluency is necessary, other languages an advantage.Additional InformationA career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including Linkedin Learning and our internal competence development system “Motimate”The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgroundsThe opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principlesA focus on fun outside of work, supported by various activity groups Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.For more information about the job, please contact Eva Nilsen, Head of Nordic Market Access Platform, via e-mail:  eva.nilsen@statkraft.com

title: Business Analyst - iMA
description: Company DescriptionIf you’re a professional with interest in driving change by utilising digital solutions, you might be our new colleague. You can start a career that helps to solve the climate crisis, with Statkraft. As a Business Analyst you will leverage the power of digitalization by implementing cutting edge green energy solutions for our customers. Realise the potential of renewable energy and make a positive impact on our planet!Why Statkraft?Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution. We believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.But there’s more work to be done. That’s why we need you to join us.Job DescriptionWorking in the digitalisation unit Nordic Market Access PlatformEnergy Management is responsible for energy management of all Statkraft’s own and 3rd party assets and consumers in Europe, delivering production planning and access to physical energy markets. We also deliver weather, hydrology, climate and market analysis across Statkraft.Digitalisation Energy Management (MED) unit supports the Energy Management (ME) business owners managing the business requirements for the IT systems on behalf of ME, with a professional interface towards IT. Furthermore, the unit supports the commercial energy management process with automation, analysis, structuring and pricing, and by providing an algorithmic trading infrastructure. The unit’s responsibility requires an in-depth understanding of the business processes and system landscape in Statkraft.  The Nordic Market Access Platform team delivers management, development and improvements of systems supporting Nordic Market Access Platform (iMA) for industrial customers, retailers and 3rd party flex assets. iMA Customer Portal is a one-stop shop for our customers in the Nordic market - covering access to physical power markets, demand side flexibility, fixed price contracts, business intelligence & analytics, risk- & contract management. The platform is also offering extensive reports and visualisation of data to external customers and internal stakeholders. iMA is built with the newest technology in the cloud, utilising flexible functionality and integrations with internal and external systems.We are now looking for a Business Analyst to join our Digitalization Unit, and to be part of our cross functional iMA product team consisting of colleagues from both business and IT. The Business Analyst will work together with external customers and internal stakeholders to define, develop, improve and implement customer-focused products and services. As Business Analyst in the Nordic Market Access Platform team you’ll:Being the bridge between business and IT, analyse, interpret and document customer requirements in cooperation with the iMA product team.  Implementing new products and functionalities by facilitating the process from requirements specifications, solutions design, testing, training and customer implementation.Facilitating customer workshops and meetings.Investigating customer business needs and problems, working with external and internal stakeholders to ensure understanding and appropriate responses.Creating documentation for external and internal customers.Understanding the business processes of a customer, identifying gaps in their requirements, and working with them to develop the user stories for scenarios they may not have considered.Supporting continuous improvementGeneral support to customers and usersQualificationsWe are looking for candidates who are high performing individuals with drive and a clear “can do” attitude. You are:Forward leaning and a fast moverCurious – sees and loves to explore new opportunitiesFearless – not afraid to failA team playerThe right candidate can see the connection between customer needs and technical opportunities in a digital platform. It is essential to take a holistic view at the same time as having attention on details.Your background/skills:University degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, or engineeringRelevant work experience from the energy sector or similar roles in different sectorsStrong communication skills and talent for building network and trusted relationships is a necessityUnderstand a technical solution/system flows as well as business processes in detailUnderstand the overall software development life cycle and its phasesUnderstanding and experience with agile ways of workingHaving an organized and structured approach to documenting requirements and solutionsEffective oral and written communications skills in English and Norwegian or SwedishAt Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to lead, teach and help others learn.Additional InformationA career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including Linkedin Learning and our internal competence development system “Motimate”The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgroundsThe opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principlesA focus on fun outside of work, supported by various activity groups Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefits schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance.Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorisation.For more information about the job, please contact Eva Nilsen, Head of Nordic Market Access Platform, via e-mail:  eva.nilsen@statkraft.com

title: International Trainee Program: Market/Energy Analysis
description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionAre you looking to kick-start your career as a trainee in Europe`s largest renewables company? Statkraft’s International Trainee program gives you the opportunity to be surrounded by and learn from smart people who care about their work positively impacting the green energy transition. We are now recruiting for trainee positions within Engineering based in Oslo.Statkraft’s International Trainee Program is a great introduction into working life. You will spend 16-months learning and developing yourself alongside other graduates and start your career in renewables. The program consists of three job rotations across the company, of which at least one will be abroad. As a trainee, you will participate in various professional development courses and gatherings to acquire new skills and share experiences. You will also get the opportunity to apply for a seat on our CEO-led Future Board initiative – an advisory board made up of trainees and young professionals in Statkraft. Trainee Nordic Asset Exposure ManagementDepartmentYou will be part of the Asset Exposure Management (MA) unit within the Business Area Markets “M”. The unit leverages M’s deep market insight, excellence in market operations, and proficiency in providing market solutions for Statkraft’s assets in Nordics, Europe, and New Energy Solutions such as portfolio management, revenue optimisation, hedging, and regulatory advisory. MA also provides support on asset development and commercial strategy. This role is placed under the MA Nordics unit (MAN).We are looking for a trainee to a member of the MAN team and you will be a key in delivering market solutions to the biggest renewable portfolio in the Nordics.
