This will entail tasks such as:Contribute the total asset exposure management for the Nordics and support portfolio management in MAN.Providing commercial strategy advise for Nordics asset development and M&A.Contribute to revenue calculations for assets.The role reports to the VP MAN.About you:We look for graduates with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions.We are seeking candidates with:Relevant higher education at Master´s level (Economics, Sciences, Engineering or similar).No more than one year of work experience post education (excluding internships/part-time jobs).Proven quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills.Collaborative work style and strong interpersonal and team skills.Understanding of financial or energy markets preferable.Ability to identify key issues, analyze data, and make recommendations to ensure the departments function meets asset owner’s expectations.Ability to translate analysis into concrete and understandable recommendations and actions.Good business acumen – commercially minded and result oriented.Self-driven and able work on several activities simultaneously and handle tight deadlines.Fluent in English, both written and spoken.At Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to lead, teach and help others learn. Trainee Energy Management NordicsDepartmentYou will be part of the Energy Management (ME) unit within the Business Area Markets (M). From hydrology and analysis of future market development, to optimizing advanced renewable power plants in a complex energy market as well as development of algorithmic trading systems and other IT. Energy Management Nordics (MEN) is responsible for market access and optimizing the income from Statkraft’s Nordic power plants.As trainee within Energy Management Nordics, you will:? Learn about the energy market, advanced renewable power plants and IT-development from a leading team of experts.? Participate in optimizing the largest portfolio of renewable assets in Europe.? Collaborate with colleagues from many parts of Statkraft, for instance hydrology, market analysis, regional control rooms, technical departments, and IT. About you:We look for a trainee with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes:Relevant higher education on Master’s level (Technical, Economics or similar).No more than one year of work experience post education (excluding internships/part-time jobs).Curiosity and interest for working in the core of Statkraft’s business.Interest for energy markets, power system operation and power plants.Collaborative work style and strong interpersonal and team skills.Good business acumen – commercially minded and result oriented.Ability to take on responsibility and make decisions in an operative working environment.Nordic language fluency is required, English language fluency is preferred.At Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. Trainee Risk Management (Düsseldorf)The Risk department in Market Operations supports the energy transition by given an independent assessment of market, credit and liquidity risks embedded in our trading, origination, and asset portfolios. We continuously enhance our risk tools for a world driven by renewable energy. Our advice is valued by senior management and plays an important part in their decision making.Working in Risk ManagementFrom helping to run advanced renewable power plants, developing the technologies that power EV charging infrastructures, to supporting our business solutions and corporate functions. With Statkraft, you’ll be working and collaborating alongside other technology and digital experts to innovate, maintain and provide the world with renewable energy.As a trainee in the Risk Department, you will:Work on market, credit and liquidity risks and develop key risk insights for our trading, origination, and asset portfolios.Apply financial and statistical theory to our energy portfolios and improve our tool kit for Statkraft’s future growth.Actively collaborate with Front Office on new and novel energy transactions across Europe, US, India, and Latin America and advise Front Office on risk issues.Drive forward the department’s digitalisation agenda to enhance operational reliability and reduce time spent on data collection and reporting, and use saved time for data analysis instead.About you:We look for a trainee with the essential skills to future-proof our business and renewable energy solutions. That includes:A university degree in a numerical discipline like Maths, Engineering, or Economics with good results.No more than one year of work experience post education (excluding internships/part-time jobs).An eagerness to turn theory into action.Working knowledge of Phyton, Mathlab or R.Basic knowledge of financial theory and financial instruments is highly desirable.A keen interest in electricity markets.Ability to pay attention to detail without getting lost by details.Willingness to innovate and improve our ways of working.Ability to simplify complex matters without being simplistic and thereby make it accessible for others outside of the risk department.At Statkraft, we’re always looking for people with great social and communication skills. People who love to lead, teach and help others learn.English language fluency is preferred.Location: DüsseldorfAdditional InformationWhat we offerA career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation.The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists, and graduates from different countries and backgrounds.The opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”.A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, and work-life balance principles.Statkraft offers competitive terms of employment and benefit schemes, and we’re a trusted employer that puts the safety of our people first. We believe that a safe and healthy working environment is a matter of choice, not chance..Location: Lilleaker, Oslo for Trainee Nordic Asset Exposure Management and Trainee Energy Management Nordics and Düsseldorf for Trainee Risk Management.Travel: some travel required and one rotation abroad during the trainee periode.To apply please attach your CV and transcripts within the application deadline 23rd of September 2023. All applications will be processed after the deadline.Please be available for the Assessment Center in Week 41 and 42 (specific dates will be shared).Trainee Program start date: 1st of September 2024.For questions, please reach out to trainee@statkraft.com, and we will handle your request as soon as possible.Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. The applicant must be eligible for security clearance and authorization.Learn more about our International Trainee Program on our website, www.statkraft.com/trainee.

ResponsibilitiesReporting to the CTO, you will take part in the development of software from coding, testing, implementation, deployment, and support.  Consistently write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to specifications. Employ best practices for designing scalable, extensible, secure applications. Design and develop web applications, web APIs and web services – see languages below.  Develop release management strategies and configure automated deployment packages for deploying application and database changes to Staging and Production environments. Assist with development team code reviews, when necessary, and also help the Hydrogen and Renewables Analyst working with Python. Qualifications & SkillsBS in computer science, engineering, or an equivalent field/experience.  3+ years of professional software engineering experience with Vue/React and Python/Kotlin/SQL. Professional English. Good at writing clean, modular, readable, and testable code. Strong knowledge of Typescript + Vue + Tailwind, Python and PostgreSQL. Good knowledge of Kotlin + Maven + Springboot framework, a good understanding of REST API principles and best practices. Experience building microservices with Python + FastAPI. Proficient with CI/CD practices and production deployment using GitHub actions Experience developing in a Cloud Platform. Experience with Container (Docker) and Container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes. Strong problem-solving skills. What we offerFull-time contract, with 6 months probation period Oslo-based hybrid position Fully remote is negotiable if the match is close to perfect. Competitive compensation package including company equity Modern offices in Oslo with high standard amenities including gym, relaxation areas and open buffet lunch. A growing team including experienced software developers with diverse backgrounds and nationalities. We aim to have a team as diverse as possible, so an open mindset and effective communication skills in English are necessary for everyone. Access to one of the fastest-growing industries that will reshape the energy sector for the next decades.

title: Commissioning Manager
description: You’ll be part of P2X Execution where you, together with your colleagues, will play an important role in the overall project execution of FlagshipONE, mainly responsible for leading and overseeing the commissioning process, ensuring the successful start-up and operation of the plant. Please note that you’re expected to relocate to Örnsköldsvik, Sweden for 15 months, as you’ll be working on the project site once construction starts.

title: Development engineer, Power-to-X
description: Do you want to apply your knowledge and skills within chemical engineering? And would you like to be a part of a company with a bold strategy of helping the world shift not only into clean energy, but also developing a revolutionary way of producing proteins for human food? We are looking for a chemical or process engineer that will help us expand our pilot facilities within SOEC electrolysis technology. The test site is currently operating SOEC systems for steam electrolysis and we need to expand the capabilities to include CO2 electrolysis as well as co-electrolysis.

title: Front-End Commissioning Engineer for P2X projects (m/f/d)
description: Imagine a future where you use your expertise to prepare Front-End strategies for thorough and efficient testing and commissioning of future P2X plants. Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for performing the operational aspects of Commissioning and Start-Up (CSU) within P2X projects in different stages of maturity and work on green hydrogen, e-methanol, e-ammonia, and e-kerosene plants.

title: Industrial Postdoc – Solid Mechanics of Electrochemical Cells
description: You will work on a two-year industrial postdoc project collaborating with Department of Energy Conversion and Storage, Technical University of Denmark (DTU). The overall objective of this project is to develop a robust and easy-to-use methodology to ensure the mechanical reliability of the multi-layered composite ceramic solid oxide electrolysis cells.

title: Key Account manager Renewables & Power to X
description: Would you like to join one of the world’s most sustainable companies as our new Key Account Manager for Renewables (Wind, Solar), Hydrogen & Power-to-X and develop further your career in these exciting and fast-growing areas? Do you feel at home in a professional innovative environment with renewable developers, entrepreneurs, and EPC partners working on electrification and decarbonization of our society? In the Key Account Manager Renewables role, you will be responsible for customer relations on existing clients and sales generation on prospects of Schneider Electric’s Ecostruxure solutions to Renewables & Green Hydrogen segment in Denmark.

title: Mekanisk ingeniør
description: Søger du et job indenfor energi og procesanlæg, i fuld fart indenfor den grønne omstilling, hvor du vil blive betroet stort ansvar samt indflydelse og gennemslagskraft? Som mekanisk ingeniør bliver du ansvarlig for mekanisk design. Du kommer til at varetage all-round plant engineering, trouble shooting, tværgående koordinering med andre ingeniørdiscipliner samt leverandører og kunder.

title: Optimisation Manager for Flexibility
description: Imagine a future where you play a key role maximising the value from our European flexible assets, enabling growth of the portfolio. Join us in this role where you’ll lead the identification, development, and management of revenue and trading opportunities for our European flexible assets, incl. battery storage and hydrogen or P2X plants.

title: PhD scholarship in Power-to-X Energy System Modelling – DTU Management
description:
The Division for Climate and Energy Policy at DTU Management offers a PhD position in the Energy Economics and Modelling (EEM) section in the suburban area of beautiful Copenhagen, Denmark.
We are looking for a talented and highly motivated engineer or economist with an interest in participating in cutting-edge research on the value of developing and using Power-to-X (PtX) modelling tools, including economic and technical aspects, as a basis for assessing the possibilities for the integration of PtX in surrounding energy systems.

title: PhD scholarship in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells - DTU Energy
description: Do you crave to develop cheap, durable and high performing solid oxide electrolysis cells with no or reduced amount of critical raw materials (CRM), to help accelerate the commercialization of the SOEC technology? Do you enjoy working in an international dynamic setting and wish to participate in an EU-funded project that will give you the opportunity to collaborate with partners from nine research institutions across Europe? This PhD position is for you. As a part of an EU-funded project, this PhD project aims to develop cheap, durable and high performing solid oxide electrolysis cells with no or reduced amount of critical materials.

title: PhD scholarship in eco-friendly fabrication of solid oxide electrolysis cells - DTU Energy
description: The Department of Energy Conversion and Storage, Technical University of Denmark (DTU), invites applications for a PhD scholarship in the development of eco-friendly ceramic processing route for the fabrication of solid oxide electrolysis cells. The successful candidate will work on the fabrication of solid oxide cells (SOCs) using aqueous based tape casting, optimization of cell microstructure and evaluation of cell performance through electrochemical characterization. In addition, the work will target improving the performance and durability of the SOCs when operating at high current density and low temperature.

title: Piccoline/Piccolo
description: Are you looking for a meaningful job whilst in the gab year? Do you want to spend the year working with an international company leading the way to a greener future? We are looking for a Piccoline/Piccolo to support the organization with a variety of administrative and practical tasks. You will primarily be supporting the reception area and HR with various administrative tasks but in-house tasks of a different nature from other departments will also occur.

title: Postdoc on jet fires
description: DBI - The Danish Institute of Fire and Security Technology is seeking an Industrial Postdoc candidate for a two-year project co-funded by the Danish Innovation Fund. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in defining case studies and risk scenarios, validating existing data, and conducting small-scale experiments on hydrogen jet fires. They will also develop and validate reactive flow simulation models, apply these models in risk assessments, and provide guidance for future users. This work is aimed at improving methodologies for hydrogen fire risk assessment.

title: Product Manager
description: Do you want to help shape the future of water treatment solutions?  As part of one of Europe's leading water treatment manufacturing companies, you will work with the best solutions and directly contribute to advancing the industry. You will be responsible for managing one or more product and technology groups, such as Filtration, Ion Exchange, RO, NF, EDI, Degassing, or Ultra Filtration, based on your skills and interests. Your primary focus is to ensure our products are up to date, competitive, high quality, and user-friendly for Sales and Service departments.

title: Project-minded Senior Lead Buyer
description: As Senior Lead Buyer, your hard work will go towards procuring all the customized and project specific technical equipment needed for a multitude of international and Capex projects with focus on Topsoe climate objective. Your job is centred around project procurement, and you will be working in a matrix organisation on various projects together with a dedicated project team. Whatever technical equipment is needed in our commercial projects, you’re the one acquiring it.

title: Sales Support Engineer
description: Are you passionate about providing technical and commercial support for international colleagues and finding the best solutions for customers? Silhorko-Eurowater A/S is growing and looking for a Sales Support Engineer to support the sales process of our water treatment solutions. As our new Sales Support Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring commercial and technical support to all our international sales departments, providing advice, and finding proper solutions in relation to the sales processes for our standard and modified products. You will be assigned as primary contact for selected customers and products.

title: Senior Category Manager
description: Do you want to initiate, govern and implement efficient and effective procurement activities across Topsoe? You will be responsible for handling Tier 1 and 2 suppliers, fabricating large quantities of standardized technical categories often using assembly lines or automation technology.

title: Senior Lead Commercial Manager
description:
Within the Power-to-X business we’re developing green hydrogen solutions that will help decarbonize our world. But we can’t do it alone, which is where you come in. We’re looking for someone to help negotiate new commercial partnerships as a Senior Lead Commercial Manager. Here are some of the things you can expect to be doing: Lead negotiations on behalf of Topsoe
Be a constructive ally to our BD team while ensuring we stay commercially focused at all times

title: Senior Project Manager for sustainable food production by electrolysis
description:
Do you want to apply your knowledge and skills within project management? And would you like to be a part of a company with a bold strategy of helping the world shift not only into clean energy, but also developing a revolutionary way of producing proteins for human food? You will make an impact by: Leading activities towards impact creation
Driving the project progression
Aligning project impact with key stakeholders, creating project overview and key deliverables

title: Team Lead for Control & Software
description:
Are you passionate about energy transition? Join us. As our Software Team Lead it is important for us that you nurture the team members, have focus on a good work environment, while ensuring high work quality and on-time deliveries. Main responsibilities Give coaching to the individual Employee enabling them to deliver the best solutions.
Have monthly and annual development meeting with the employees
Keep the team informed about the overall status of the business. Nel as a company offers a challenging role with many exciting tasks and interfaces. Competitive salary and good insurance and pension schemes.

title: Test Technician
description: Are you an experienced Technician working with process or gas equipment? Are you familiar with Factory Acceptance Tests? Do you have strong problem-solving skills? The Test team is conducting production- and factory acceptance test according to the overall production test plan. As Test Technician your focus is commissioning and testing of plants on our site in Kolding, test of submodules, troubleshooting, reporting and corrections of errors. Assembly quality, reduction of assembly time and errors are key success criteria in the role.

title: Commissioning Engineer
description: Are you experienced in installation, commissioning and servicing of technical process plants? Are you ready to become a key person delivering electrolysis plants to our customers? Is safety also your uncompromising number one? The job as Commissioning Engineer involves both mechanical assembly, electrical and automation tasks and troubleshooting, and you will be responsible for the on-site project progress and follow-up. As a member of our team, you get a unique opportunity to work with dedicated colleagues and make a mark on a company that is expanding within a fast growing industry. We provide great development opportunities in a growing organisation where Care, Commit and Collaborate are our key drivers.

title: Compliance Engineer
description: A Hydrogen filling station is a complex construction which contains hydrogen under high pressure in an advanced process with electrical- and mechanical components in the ATEX zone and where the Hydrogen must be cooled down before it is refueled on the vehicle. Therefor you will be responsible for ensuring that the system is developed in accordance with the applicable standards, regulations, and codes (Pressure Directive) and approved by external authorities e.g., CE, UL, ATEX.

Har du en praktisk baggrund med forskellige vedligeholdelses- og serviceopgaver? Vil du være en del af en virksomhed i vækst og sikre at vores nybyggede site fungerer effektivt? Går du forrest i at skabe et sikkert og effektivt arbejdsmiljø? Som Facility Technician, bliver du en del af vores Production Technology Team, som består af 15 medarbejdere med mange forskellige kompetencer. Dine primære arbejdsopgaver vil bl.a. være: Håndtering af inventar og teknisk inventar som fx AV- og IT-udstyr
Sikkerhedskiltning, opmærkninger og sikringscheck
Affaldshåndtering, skiltning og kontrol af miljøstation

You will have great influence and flexibility in your daily work, supporting the entire organisation and driving your own projects as well. To succeed in the role, you need excellent planning and organising skills combined with system flair and an interest in improving the effectiveness of our HR processes.

We are looking for skilled leaders that enjoy being part of a growing industry developing new technologies for decarbonization from drawing board to commercialization.

We offer a contemporary workplace and frequent interaction with colleagues across our locations.

description: Har du lyst til at arbejde med et område, som har stor betydning for den enkelte borger, samfundet og den grønne omstilling? Vil du bruge din faglighed til at hindre markedsmisbrug? Som data scientist i Center for transmission, engrosmarked, REMIT og int. forhold - TERI, bliver du en del af et center, hvor vi arbejder med det europæiske energisamarbejde på el- og gas-markederne – herunder forebyggelse og håndhævelse af EU-reglerne om markedsmisbrug.

You will turn data into insights, provide senior leaders with accurate and insightful analysis, support and facilitate decision making. Your responsibilities will include:

description: Vil du arbejde med drift og vedligeholdelse på et af vores 2 underjordiske gaslagringsanlæg i Danmark? Og vil du samtidig bidrage til at accelerere den grønne omstilling af vores energisystem og forberede vores anlæg til at kunne håndtere Power2X, brintlagring og andre af fremtidens energiløsninger? Så er stillingen som mekanisk tekniker hos Gas Storage Denmark (GSD) måske netop noget for dig.

title: PhD Scholarships in Plasma Physics and Fusion Energy - DTU Physics
description: Are you interested in contributing to solve the energy crisis by developing a clean sustainable energy source which replicates the Sun on Earth? Would you like to work in a team with a strong feeling of purpose and belonging? The section for Plasma Physics and Fusion Energy (PPFE) at Department of Physics, Technical University of Denmark (DTU) is seeking two highly motivated physicists or engineers to initiate a three-year PhD project in experimental and numerical plasma physics.

title: PhD position 1 in experimental surface science for: Discovering New Dual and Triple Atom Catalysts - DTU Physics
description: The position is funded by the DETECT project which is an ERC-COG grant from the European Research Council. The overarching aim of this project is to discover and establish new fundamental insight into the catalytic activity of duel and triple atom catalysts. The position will be focused on synthesis, characterization and testing of the dual and triple atom catalysts using state-of-the-art in-house facilities or synchrotrons at SLAC or Lund.

title: PhD position 2 in electrochemistry and surface science for: Discovering New Dual and Triple Atom Catalysts - DTU Physics
description: The position is funded by the DETECT project which is an ERC-COG grant from the European Research Council. The overarching aim of this project is to discover and establish new fundamental insight into the catalytic activity of duel and triple atom catalysts. The position will be focused on electrochemical testing and characterization of the dual and triple atom catalysts produced by other group members using cluster sources.

Føre tilsyn med energi- og transmissionsselskaberne i Danmark Du vil i det daglige opleve en stor grad af frihed og fleksibilitet, som sikrer en god balance mellem arbejde og fritid. Vi er en familievenlig arbejdsplads, og du får bl.a. mulighed for at arbejde under transport samt mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

title: Student Worker
description: We are looking for a talented and motivated student worker to join our Documentation Department. You will be supporting our Documentation team, who manages documentation and supports other departments, with the creation of technical work instructions and manuals. The position is in Lind near Herning and the weekly working hours will amount up to an average of 15-20 hours, however we will accommodate to your academic schedule and adjust your assignments accordingly. You are currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree within the field of Communications, Business, Engineering, or other relevant studies.

title: Automation Engineer
description: Do you want to work with PtX and be one of those who put a technical mark on our projects? As Automation Engineer at Everfuel you will be responsible for developing the automation architecture, specifications, designs, tools, and processes ranging from PLC programming through SCADA setup to interfaces to the Everfuel cloud platform “Helios”. The position will be perfect for you if you enjoy working in a dynamic and flat organization. Everyone is equally vital at Everfuel– because together, we can achieve so much more and with even better results.

title: Commercial Asset Manager, Swedish Portfolio
description: Would it motivate you to work with the commercial aspects of our renewable assets in Sweden? And would you like to bring purpose to your career? Then come and join us and play a significant role in enabling the green transition with us! As our new Commercial Asset Manager, you will handle commercial asset management services for renewable energy assets for external investors and our portfolio of wind parks, primarily in Sweden.

title: HSE Site Supervisor
description:
Are you passionate about creating safe and secure work environments? Do you have a strong background in health, safety, and environmental practices? Join our dynamic Global QHSE team at Nel Hydrogen and play a vital role in ensuring the well-being of our employees and the integrity of our operations. What will you get from working with us? An opportunity to work in a company in strong growth and a leading position in the market.
Competitive salary, as well as a variable incentive compensation plan

title: High-tech company is looking for a Physicist or Nanoscience PhD for sensor development
description:
Are you passionate about creating and conveying groundbreaking new technology? And do you want to develop sensors for future benefit to the environment? Your primary tasks as our physicist will be, to: Drive the adaptation and optimization of the core sensor technology towards products
Advance our technology to an industrialized sensor fabricated platform
Design and handling of sensors based on polymer/composite materials

title: International developer – for decarbonisation through green gasses
description: Are you motivated by an outgoing role where all results are yielded in close cooperation with others? And are you able to present our position, involve others and find pragmatic compromises? Your job involves many different relations, meetings and cooperations with internal colleagues on policy, energy system development, markets and operation – as well as close and regular contact/travels to other transmission system operators in neighbouring countries (Sweden, Germany, Netherlands, Poland) and European organisations working on decarbonisation through green gasses, security of supply, energy system and infrastructure.

title: Lageroperatør til produktionsvirksomhed
description: Som vores nye lageroperatør bliver du en del af vores lagerteam, hvor I sammen er med til at sikre effektiv process hele vejen fra varemodtagelse, registrering, ind-lagering, produktions-pluk til for forsendelse af vores færdige produkter. Du bliver en del af et team med et tæt samarbejde, hvor du vil tage del i optimering af vores arbejdsgange, som altid er i fokus hos os. Vi har bl.a. implementeret et topmoderne WMS-system i vores nybyggede hovedkvarter med højlager og lagerautomater. Click here to read this job ad in English

title: Medarbejder med teknisk snilde
description: Som kommende medarbejder hos Green Hydrogen Systems A/S i Kolding, får du en unik mulighed for at sætte dit aftryk på den grønne omstilling og bidrage til en virksomed i vækst. Foruden den grønne omstilling, lægges der vægt på det gode samarbejde, både internt i den enkelte afdeling og på tværs af organisationen. Som montagemedarbejder bliver du en del af en produktion på mere end 50 medarbejdere, som i fællesskab sikre montagen af diverse dele og elementer til deres elektrolyseanlæg. Du skal være åben og omstillingsparat, da de roterer i afdelingen, og det er derfor en kæmpe force, hvis du kan tilgå forskellige opgaver. Dine opgaver vil indebære bla. bukning af rør, opbyggelse af rammer til tavler, montage af diverse dele samt sørge for at tilkoble elektronikken og ledningerne til.

title: Phd Scholarship In Catalyst Development For Electrochemical Production Of Hydrogen Peroxide - DTU Energy
description: Are you passionate about electrocatalysis and Power-to-X technologies? Do you enjoy working closely with industry partners to convert research findings into cutting-edge products? If so, we have the perfect PhD opportunity for you. The focus of this PhD project is to synthesize atomically dispersed metal electrocatalysts with uniform and high-density active sites through a sequential synthesis process, aiming to precisely control the structures of the active sites.

title: Project Engineer - hydrogen installations
description: Do you focus on the details, and are you motivated by being the technical lead in the construction of hydrogen fueling stations and electrolysis plants? Everfuel offers you a great opportunity to get front row insight and direct impact in the growing PtX industry and the transition from fossil fuels to zero emission! Your tasks will include: Detailed mechanical engineering from PFD to P&IDs for PtX and fuelling stationsPrepare descriptions, specifications, and tender material for sub suppliersSelection and cooperation with partners and suppliers

title: Project Manager 0 Data transformation
description:
The project manager will drive and deliver smaller Data and digitalization projects, as well as ensure PMO perfection on larger scale programs. Furthermore, we expect you to: enable a true Data driven organization through global Data governance, policy and automation.
enable system agnostic Data solution – where data is driving the solution and systems are enabling the efficiency using the right data.
help the organization to see data as an asset, creating the need for data through understanding, benefit and need rather than by rules

title: R&D Laboratory Engineer
description: Are you a technically proficient troubleshooter with practical experience in developing and maintaining laboratory equipment? Have you worked in a research environment? As R&D Lab Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring a fully functional and safe laboratory. This includes designing and building new laboratory test equipment, managing test schedules, troubleshooting, and performing equipment maintenance. Our department plays a vital role conducting research on advanced materials. We actively collaborate with leading universities on research projects, exploring cutting-edge materials to enhance product efficiency.

title: SHEQ Director/VP
description: Are you enthusiastic about developing and implementing innovative SHEQ strategies that drive organisational success? Do you thrive ensuring exceptional quality while upholding the highest standards of Health, Safety, and Environmental responsibility? Do you have a professional passion for creating a safe and sustainable work environment? As the SHEQ Director/VP, you are responsible for defining and driving our Health, Safety, Environment and Quality strategy. Reporting directly to the COO, you will lead the development, implementation, and management of our SHEQ systems, ensuring compliance with ISO 9001, 14001, and 45001 standards. Your role includes fostering a culture of safety consciousness and uncompromising quality assurance within Green Hydrogen Systems.

title: Senior Consultant / Associate Manager driving the Green Transition (M&A)
description: Are you passionate about building a successful career in the field of business consulting and sustainability, and are you motivated to contribute actionable insights to business leaders? We are seeking bright minds to join our Strategic Sustainability Consulting department, where you will have the chance to push the boundaries of your profession and develop excellence in an open, collaborative and empowering culture.

title: Senior Control Engineer
description: Do you enjoy taking the lead on design control activities, where you would have to be at the forefront to ensure the right quality and execution? Then you may be the new colleague we are looking for to join our team of Everfuellers! As a Senior Control Engineer at Everfuel, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing control systems for our groundbreaking projects. Your expertise will be crucial in ensuring the seamless integration of our assets into our extensive value chain from electricity sourcing to green hydrogen delivery to the customer. You will have the opportunity to lead design control activities, author and review control design and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact solutions.

title: Senior Process Engineer - Denmark
description: Are you passionate about Process Engineering and do you have what it takes to drive the further development of DIS's activities within this field? As a Process Engineer at DIS, you will experience an independent job and a varied workday with professional challenges matching your competences. You will be involved in small and large development projects and will be responsible for project implementation in close dialogue with our customers across many industries.

description: Would you like to be technical lead in process engineering of PtX projects? As the Senior Process Engineer, you will be part of the engineering team who deliver the engineering solutions and capacities to a successful project execution of complex electrolysers and fueling stations projects in tight cooperation with internal and external stakeholders who form the project team led by the Project Manager. You have a relevant educational background most likely on an engineering level with a minimum of 5 years of experience from related jobs.

title: Senior Process Engineer – R&D
description: Do you have lead experience within Flow Process and System Design within technical and industrial environments? Would you like to be technical lead for the process design packages within electrolyzers and fueling stations? Your tasks will include: Process design, system design and process controls. From design basis to PFD to P&IDReviews, verification, and integrations of workflowsQuality-analysis reporting (defining KPI’s, regular reporting and driving continuous improvements)

title: Senior Business Development Director
